definition: An arid subtropical condition is a subtropical condition in which an environmental system has an annual average temperature near 18.2 degrees Celsius with their coldest month averaging between 2 and 13 degrees Celsius, the absence of regular rainfall, and high humidity.

label: highland subtropical
definition: A highland subtropical condition is a subtropical condition in which increased elevation results in mild summers, cooler winters, and, in some instances,  snowfall associated with montly temperature averages below 22 but above -3 degrees Celsius.

label: oceanic temperate
definition: An oceanic temperate condition is a temperate condition which is strongly influenced by oceans and oceanic winds. Summers are cool and winters are cool, but not cold, and there is little frozen precipitation at lower elevations.

label: continental temperate
definition: A continental temperate condition is a temperate condition which is influenced by large land masses. Summers are warm to hot and winters are often  long, cold, and snowy.

label: cold desert
definition: A cold desert is a desert which has hot summers and cold, dry winters with temperatures below 0 degrees Celsius

label: temperate evergreen needleleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some temperate| some temperate coniferous forest biome|needleleaf forest
definition: An evergreen needleleaf forest which is subject to temperate environmental conditions.

label: tropical lowland evergreen broadleaf rain forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some tropical| some tropical moist broadleaf forest biome|tropical moist broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical moist broadleaf forest which is subject to high rainfall, is located in a lowland area, and is dominated by plants which retain their leaves throughout the year.

label: temperate deciduous broadleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some temperate| some temperate broadleaf forest biome|tropical broadleaf forest
definition: A deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate deciduous needleleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some temperate| some temperate coniferous forest biome|needleleaf forest
definition: A deciduous needleleaf forest which is subject to temperate environmental conditions.

label: tropical deciduous broadleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some tropical| some tropical broadleaf forest biome|tropical broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest which comprises tree communities dominated by deciduous species.

label: tropical semi-deciduous broadleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some tropical| some tropical broadleaf forest biome|tropical broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest which has a mixed composition of deciduous and evergreen trees, with deciduous trees predominating.

label: temperate mixed broadleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (temperate broadleaf forest biome and temperate mixed forest biome)| some temperate|temperate mixed forest
definition: A temperate mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with broad leaves.

label: temperate mixed needleleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some temperate| some temperate mixed forest biome|temperate mixed forest
definition: A temperate mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with needle-like leaves (e.g. conifers).

label: tropical semi-evergreen moist broadleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some tropical| some tropical moist broadleaf forest biome|tropical moist broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical moist broadleaf forest which has a mixed composition of deciduous and evergreen trees, with evergreen trees predominating.

label: tropical upper montane forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some tropical| some upper montane|high-elevation forest
definition: A high-elevation forest which is located in a region subject to tropical climate patterns modulated by sufficient elevation to encounter upper montane climate patterns.

label: tropical lower montane forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some lower montane| some tropical|high-elevation forest
definition: A high-elevation forest which is located in a region subject to tropical climate patterns modulated by sufficient elevation to encounter lower montane climatic patterns.

label: tropical freshwater swamp forest
definition: A freshwater swamp forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate sclerophyllous dry forest
definition: A sclerophyllous forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical sclerophyllous dry forest
definition: A sclerophyllous forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate broadleaf evergreen forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some temperate broadleaf forest biome|temperate broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf evergreen forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate freshwater swamp forest
definition: A freshwater swamp forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical needleleaf forest
subClassOf [LABEL]: some tropical| some tropical coniferous forest biome|needleleaf forest
definition: A needleleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: tropical mixed needleleaf forest
definition: A tropical mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with needle-like leaves (e.g. conifers).

label: tropical mixed broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with broad leaves.

label: obsolete manufactured plastic
definition: OBSOLETE A (portion of) plastic is an (portion of) anthropogenic environmental material including any of numerous organic synthetic or processed materials which are primarily composed of thermoplastic or thermosetting polymers of high molecular weight.

label: respirable suspended particulate matter
definition: A portion of respirable suspended particulate matter is a form of particulate matter composed primarily of solid particles each with a diameter of 10 micrometers or less.

label: snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some snow crystal))| some air| some snowfall| some water ice|environmental material
definition: Snow is an environmental material which is primarily composed of flakes of crystalline water ice.

label: littoral zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some aquatic environment| some coast|aquatic environment
definition: An aquatic environment which is the part of a sea, lake, or river that is close to the shore.

label: environmental zone
definition: A site which has its extent determined by the presence or influence of one or more components of an environmental system or the processes occurring therein.

label: freshwater littoral zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (freshwater lake or freshwater river)|littoral zone
definition: A freshwater littoral zone is a littoral zone which extends offshore from the shore of a freshwater body of water to the limit of occupancy of rooted plants.

label: marine eulittoral zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (marine supra-littoral zone and marine sub-littoral zone)| some marine environment| some marine littoral zone|marine environmental zone
definition: The eulittoral zone extends from the spring high tide line, which is rarely inundated, to the spring low tide line, which is rarely not inundated. The wave action and turbulence of recurring tides shapes and reforms cliffs, gaps, and caves, offering a huge range of habitats for sedentary organisms.

label: infralittoral zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine sub-littoral zone|marine environmental zone
definition: A zone which is part of the sublittoral zone and is dominated by algae. This zone usually extends up to five metres below the low water mark.

label: circalittoral zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine sub-littoral zone|marine environmental zone
definition: A zone which is part of the sublittoral zone and is dominated by sessile animals such as oysters. This zone usually begins at a depth greater than the infralittoral zone.

label: old plant
definition: A whole plant which is relatively old

label: young plant
definition: A whole plant which is relatively young.

label: fine respirable suspended particulate matter
definition: A portion of fine respirable suspended particulate matter is a form of particulate matter composed primarily of solid particles each with a diameter of 2.5 micrometers or less.

label: ultrafine respirable suspended particulate matter
definition: A portion of fine respirable suspended particulate matter is a form of particulate matter composed primarily of solid particles each with a diameter of  100 nanometers or less.

label: house
definition: A house is a building that provides a dwelling-place for a living entity.

label: human house
subClassOf [LABEL]: some usage of an environment for residential activity|house

label: domestic garden
definition: A garden that is associated with a human house. This association is generally one of spatial proximity or parthood.

label: building part
definition: A building part is a construction which is part of a building.

label: indoor kitchen
definition: An indoor kitchen is a room or part of a room primarily used  for cooking or food preparation, but which may have other funcitons such as dining, food storage, dishwashing, or laundry.

label: bathroom
definition: A bathroom is a room which contains a washbasin or other fixture, such as a shower or bath, used for bathing by humans.

label: living room
definition: A living room is a room in a human house which is used for social and domestic leisure activities.

label: patio
definition: A patio is a paved outdoor area, adjacent to a human house, and used for dining or recreation.

label: indoor toilet
definition: An indoor toilet is a room which contains a sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human urine and faeces.

label: room
definition: A building part which is separated from other building parts by one or more interior walls and, optionally, outdoor areas by one or more exterior walls.

label: carbon nanotube enriched soil
subClassOf [LABEL]: enriched soil|has increased levels of some
definition: A portion of carbon nanotube enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of carbon nanotubes.

label: area of rocky shore
definition: A rocky shore is an intertidal area of a seacoast where solid rock is the predominant substrate.

label: burrow
definition: A burrow is a hole or tunnel excavated into the ground by an animal to create a space suitable for habitation, temporary refuge, or as a byproduct of locomotion

label: broadleaf forest
definition: A forest biome which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: mixed forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf and coniferous trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: sclerophyllous forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is dominated by trees adapted to dry or arid environmental conditions.

label: high-elevation forest
definition: A forest which is subject to montane or alpine environmental conditions.

label: waterborne particulate matter
subClassOf [LABEL]: some solid environmental material|particulate environmental material|surrounded by some liquid water
definition: Particulate environmental material in which small portions of solid material are surrounded by water.

label: lava field
definition: A lava field is an expanse of flat-lying lava flows. Such features are generally composed of highly fluid basalt lava, and can extend for tens or even hundreds of miles across the underlying terrain.

label: lava flow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some effusive eruption| some lava|body of liquid
definition: A lava flow is a moving outpouring of lava, which is created during a non-explosive effusive eruption.

label: andesitic volcano
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (volcanic eruption and ( some intermediate lava))| some andesite|volcano
definition: A volcano which has been formed as a result of the eruption of andesitic lava.

label: dacitic volcano
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (volcanic eruption and ( some dacitic lava))| some dacite|volcano
definition: A volcano which has been formed as a result of the eruption of dacitic lava.

label: andesite
definition: Andesite is an extrusive igneous, volcanic rock, of intermediate composition, with aphanitic to porphyritic texture.

label: dacite
definition: Dacite is an igneous, volcanic rock. It has an aphanitic to porphyritic texture and is intermediate in composition between andesite and rhyolite.  Dacite consists mostly of plagioclase feldspar with biotite, hornblende, and pyroxene (augite and/or enstatite). It has quartz as rounded, corroded phenocrysts, or as an element of the ground-mass. The plagioclase ranges from oligoclase to andesine and labradorite. Sanidine occurs, although in small proportions, in some dacites, and when abundant gives rise to rocks that form transitions to the rhyolites.

label: salt mass
definition: An accumulation of a salt, typically sodium chloride.

label: dacitic lava
definition: Lava which is high in silica and low in alkali metal oxides.

label: disturbed ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which has been subject to a perturbation, that is, the ecosystem has undergone a pronounced change in response to a change in environmental conditions or other perturbation.

label: ravine
definition: A ravine is a small, narrow, steep-sided valley that is larger than a gully and smaller than a canyon and that is usually worn by running water.

label: roadside
subClassOf [LABEL]: some anthropisation| some landmass| some road|anthropogenic geographic feature
definition: An environmental zone of varying area which is adjacent to a road.

label: mixed grassland
definition: A grassland which contains a mixture of tall and short grasses.

label: wet meadow ecosystem
definition: A wet meadow is a type of wetland with soils that are saturated with water for part or all of the growing season.

label: salt glacier
definition: A mass of salt which has erupted onto a planetary surface, usually through sedimentary rock.

label: atmospheric carbon dioxide
subClassOf [LABEL]: some |( some atmosphere) and ( some )|gaseous environmental material
definition: Atmospheric carbon dioxide is an environmental material composed of carbon dioxide in its gaseous form present in an atmosphere.

label: environmental disposition
definition: A disposition which is realised by an environmental system or system parts thereof.

label: carbon pooling disposition
definition: The disposition of an environmental system to sequester and store carbon.

label: carbon dioxide pooling disposition
definition: The disposition of an environment to sequester carbon dioxide, subsequently storing the carbon component thereof.

label: material pooling disposition
definition: The disposition of an environmental system to sequester and store some material entity.

label: concrete masonry unit
definition: A concrete masonry unit is a large, rectangular masonry unit primarily composed of concrete.

label: masonry unit
definition: A masonry unit is a solid piece of material, usually with a regular shape, used as a component in the construction of buildings. Masonry units are usually composed of brick, stone, marble, granite, travertine, limestone, cast stone, concrete block, glass block, stucco, tile, or cob.

label: concrete
definition: Concrete is a composite material composed of an aggregate bonded together with a fluid cement which hardens over time.

label: asphalt concrete
definition: Asphaltic concrete is a concrete which uses refined asphalt as a cement.

label: asphalt
definition: Asphalt also known as bitumen is a sticky, black, and highly viscous liquid or semi-solid form of petroleum.

label: refined asphalt
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some manufacturing process| some petroleum|liquid environmental material
definition: Refined asphalt is a sticky, black, and highly viscous liquid or semi-solid with a boiling point above 500 degrees Celsius, obtained from the fractional distillation of crude oil.

label: masonry cement
definition: Masonry cement is a substance used in construction that has the disposition to set and harden and thus may be used to bind materials together.

label: hydraulic cement
definition: Hydraulic cement is a masonry cement which contains activated aluminium silicates or pozzolans, such as fly ash, allowing it to set in wet conditions or underwater.

label: non-hydraulic cement
definition: Non-hydraulic cement is a cement which sets by reacting with carbon dioxide in the air and will not set in wet conditions or underwater. It is susceptible to attack by aggresive chemicals after setting.

label: building wall
definition: Building walls are bulding parts which serve to support roofs, floors and ceilings; enclose a space as part of the building envelope; give buildings form; and to provide shelter and security.

label: boundary wall
definition: A boundary wall is a constructed barrier which is usually opaque, constructed from masonry, and of greater structural strength than a fence.

label: constructed barrier
definition: A constructed barrier is a freestanding wall, berm, or fence built to limit movement of entities across a boundary.

label: fence
definition: A fence is a constructed barrier which is  generally of lighter construction than a wall and used to provide visual sectioning of spaces.

label: exterior wall
definition: An exterior wall is a building wall which separates the interior of a building from the buildings surrounding environment.

label: building envelope
subClassOf [LABEL]: some building roof| some exterior wall|building part
definition:
A building envelope is a building part composed of those building parts which physically separate the interior of a building from its surrounding environment.
The building envelope provides resistance to air, water, heat, light, and noise transfer. The three basic elements of a building envelope are a weather barrier, air barrier, and thermal barrier.

label: ceiling
SYNONYMS: A ceiling is an overhead interior surface that covers the upper limit of a room. It is not generally considered a structural element, but a finished surface concealing the underside of the floor or roof structure above.

label: building roof
definition: A roof is the covering on the uppermost part of a building which provides protection from animals and weather, notably rain, but also heat, wind and sunlight. A roof is also the framing or structure which supports the covering

label: thatch
definition: Thatch is material composed of dry vegetation such as straw, water reed, sedge (Cladium mariscus), rushes, or heather.

label: brick material
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some manufacturing process|solid environmental material
definition: A portion of brick material is a material derived from a brick which is composed of  kneaded clay-bearing soil, expanded clay aggregate, sand and lime, or concrete that has been fire-hardened or air-dried.

label: brick
definition: A brick is a masonry unit which is composed of kneaded clay-bearing soil, expanded clay aggregate, sand and lime, or concrete material, fire-hardened or air-dried.

label: plaster
definition: Plaster is a building material which has the disposition to harden when it reacts with water, liberating heat through crystallization. Plaster is manufactured as a dry powder and is mixed with water to form a paste when used.

label: gypsum plaster
definition: Gypsum plaster is a plaster which is formed by partially dehydrating gypsum by heating it to approximately 150 degrees Celsius and grinding the product into a powder. Gypsum anhydride - formed by heating gypsum above 200 degrees Celsius - may also be used as plaster.

label: lime plaster
definition: Lime plaster is a plaster which is primarily composed of calcium hydroxide and an inert filler (such as sand). Coversion of the calcium hydroxide to calcium carbonate through a reaction with carbon dioxide in the air causes the plaster to set.

label: glass
definition: Glass is an amorphous (non-crystalline) solid which is often transparent.

label: silica-based glass
definition: Silica-based glass is a glass composed primarily of silicon dioxide, the primary constituent of sand.

label: soda-lime glass
definition: Soda-lime glass is a silica-based glass which is composed of approximately 75% silicon dioxide, with sodium oxide and calcium oxide consituting most of its remaining composition.

label: flat glass
definition: Flat glass is a soda-lime glass which is composed of approximately 73% silicon dioxide (silica), 14% sodium oxide, 9% calcium oxide, 4% magnesium oxide, 0.15% aluminium oxide, 0.03% potassium oxide, 0.02% titanum dioxide, and 0.01% iron III oxide.

label: container glass
definition: Container glass is a soda-lime glass which is composed of approximately 74% silicon dioxide (silica), 13% sodium oxide, 10.5% calcium oxide, 1.3% aluminium oxide, 0.3% potassium oxide, 0.2% sulphur trioxide, 0.2% magnesium oxide,  0.04% iron III oxide, and 0.01%  titanum dioxide.

label: quartz glass
definition: Quartz glass is a glass which is composed of silica in amorphous (non-crystalline) form.

label: building floor
definition: A building floor is a surface layer which is part of a building and used for walking.

label: brick building floor
definition: A brick building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of brick material or is built from bricks.

label: wooden building floor
definition: A wooden building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of wood.

label: concrete building floor
definition: A concrete building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of concrete

label: sandy building floor
definition: A sandy building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of sand.

label: glass building floor
definition: A glass building floor is a building floor which is composed primarily of glass.

label: dung building floor
definition: A dung building floor is a building floor which is composed primarily of dried animal feces.

label: stone building floor
definition: A stone building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of rock.

label: thatched exterior wall
definition: A thatched exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of thatch.

label: stone exterior wall
definition: A stone exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of rock.

label: straw exterior wall
definition: A straw exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of straw.

label: mud exterior wall
definition: A mud exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of mud.

label: pole
definition: A solid, cylindrical object or column with its length greater than its diameter.

label: pole-reinforced mud exterior wall
SYNONYMS: mud and poles exterior wall|mud and poles wall
definition: A pole-reinforced mud exterior wall is a mud exterior wall which is supported and reinforced by poles.

label: brick exterior wall
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brick| some brick material|exterior wall
definition: A brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from bricks.

label: burnt brick
definition: A burnt brick is a brick which has been dried at an elvated temperature in a kiln, furnace, or with similar technology .

label: unburnt brick
definition: An unburnt brick is a brick which has been air dried rather than dried at an elvated temperature in a kiln, furnace, or with similar technology .

label: burnt-brick exterior wall
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brick material| some burnt brick|brick exterior wall
definition: A burnt brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from burnt bricks.

label: unburnt-brick exterior wall
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brick material| some unburnt brick|brick exterior wall
definition: An unburnt brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from unburnt bricks.

label: salt dome
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some salt material|surface landform
definition: A dome-shaped mass of salt formed when a thick bed of evaporite minerals (mainly salt, or halite) found at depth intrudes vertically into surrounding rock strata, forming a diapir.

label: concrete exterior wall
subClassOf [LABEL]: some concrete| some concrete masonry unit|exterior wall
definition: A concrete exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of concrete.

label: iron sheet
definition: An iron sheet is a mass of iron which has been forged into a roughly planar form of less than 6 millimetres in thickness.

label: sheet-iron exterior wall
SYNONYMS: iron sheet wall|sheet iron wall|sheet-iron wall
definition: A sheet-iron exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from sheets of iron.

label: sheet-iron building roof
SYNONYMS: iron sheet building roof|sheet iron roof|sheet-iron roof
definition: A sheet-iron building roof is a building roof that is built from sheets of iron.

label: thatched building roof
definition: A thatched building roof is a building roof that is built by thatching (or out of thatch).

label: wooden building roof
definition: A wooden building roof is a building roof that is built from wood.

label: asbestos building roof
definition: An asbestos building roof is a building roof that is built from asbestos.

label: tile
definition: A tile is a manufactured piece of hard-wearing material such as ceramic, stone, metal, or even glass, generally used for covering roofs, floors, walls, showers, or other objects such as tabletops. Alternatively, tile can sometimes refer to similar units made from lightweight materials such as perlite, wood, and mineral wool, typically used for wall and ceiling applications.

label: tiled building roof
definition: A tile building roof is a building roof that is built using tiles.

label: toilet fixture
definition: A fixture which is used primarily for the collection and, in some cases, disposal of human urine and feces.

label: pit latrine
definition: A pit latrine is a latrine which is constructed by digging a hole in the ground.

label: diapir
definition: A diapir is a type of geologic intrusion in which a more mobile and ductily deformable material is forced into brittle overlying rocks due to its higher buoyancy.

label: latrine
definition: A latrine is a toilet which is of simple construction (relative to a flush or chemical toilet) and typically intended for communal use.

label: latrine slab
definition: A latrine slab is a  broad, flat, thick piece of solid material (typically stone or concrete) used as the floor of a latrine and which includes a hole through which excreta are deposited into a latrine pit.

label: batholith
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (igneous intrusion process and planetary erosion)| some igneous rock|rock intrusion
definition: A batholith is an area of mostly continuous plutonic (igneous intrusive) rock that covers an area larger than 100 square kilometers, formed in the planetary crust, and exposed by erosion. On Earth, Batholiths are almost always made mostly of felsic or intermediate rock-types, such as granite, quartz monzonite, or diorite.

label: latrine pit
definition: A latrine pit is an artificial hole or cavity in the ground used to collect human excreta.

label: pit latrine with slab floor
definition: A pit latrine with a slab floor is a pit latrine which has a latrine slab as a floor.

label: outhouse
definition: An outhouse is a small structure, separate from a main building, which covers a pit latrine or a dry toilet.

label: rock intrusion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some rock| some rock-precursor intrusion process|intrusion
definition: An intrusion which is primarily composed of rock which has been formed within a pre-existing fracture in a larger mass of rock.

label: sedimentary intrusion
definition: A rock intrusion which is composed primarily of sedimentary rock.

label: flush toilet fixture
definition: A toilet fixture which uses water to flush liquid and solid excreta into a sewage containment or processing facility through a drainpipe.

label: dry toilet fixture
definition: A toilet fixture which uses little to no water; excreta is removed manually or composted in situ.

label: chemical toilet fixture
definition: A chemical toilet fixture is a toilet fixture which uses chemicals to deodorise and treat excreta which is stored in the fixture.

label: ventilated improved pit latrine
definition: A ventilated improved pit latrine is a pit latrine which includes a vent pipe fitted to the pit with a flyscreen covering the pipe's outlet. Air currents moving across the outlet of the vent pipe create a vaccum which draws odors out of the latrine's superstructure.

label: covered latrine
definition: A covered latrine is a building which comprises a latrine sheltered by an outhouse.

label: covered pit latrine
definition: A covered pit latrine is a building which comprises a pit latrine sheltered by an outhouse.

label: covered pit latrine with slab floor
definition: A covered pit latrine with slab is a building which comprises a pit latrine with a slab floor sheltered by an outhouse.

label: pour-flush toilet fixture
SYNONYMS: bog|comfort room|dunny|flush toilet|head|john|lavatory|loo|pot|pour flush toilet fixture|the heads|toilet|water closet
definition: A flush toilet fixture into which water is manually poured to dispose of excreta.

label: pour-flush pit latrine
definition: A pit latrine which includes a water seal (U-trap or siphon) used over one or two offset pits instead of a plain hole or seat. Water is manually poured through the trap to flush excreta into the latrine pit.

label: factory
subClassOf [LABEL]: some industrial building| some usage of an environment for industry|industrial building
definition: A factory (previously manufactory) or manufacturing plant is an industrial site, usually consisting of buildings and machinery, or more commonly a complex having several buildings, where workers manufacture goods or operate machines processing one product into another.

label: atmospheric ozone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some atmosphere|gaseous environmental material
definition: Atmospheric ozone is an environmental material primarily composed of ozone in its gaseous form and present in an atmosphere.

label: stratosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: (( some mesosphere) and ( some troposphere)) and ( some atmosphere)|atmospheric layer
definition: The layer of the atmosphere which is sandwiched between the troposphere and mesosphere. Of the energy that reaches the Earth from the sun, only 3% is absorbed in the stratosphere, but that includes the vitally important process of absorption of ultraviolet radiation by the stratospheric ozone layer. The stratosphere is cloudless and dust free, and almost unaffected by the turbulent conditions of the underlying level of the atmosphere. (Source: WRIGHT)

label: mesosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: (( some stratosphere) and ( some thermosphere)) and ( some atmosphere)|atmospheric layer
definition: The mesosphere is part of the earth's atmosphere which is between the stratosphere and the thermosphere in which temperature decreases with altitude to the atmosphere's absolute minimum

label: troposphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: (( some planetary surface) and ( some stratosphere)) and ( some atmosphere)|atmospheric layer
definition: The lowest of the concentric layers of the atmosphere, occurring between the Earth's surface and the tropopause. It is the zone where atmospheric turbulence is at its greatest and where the bulk of the Earth's weather is generated. It contains almost all the water vapour and aerosols and three-quarters of the total gaseous mass of the atmosphere. Throughout the troposphere temperature decreases with height at a mean rate of 6.5C/km and the whole zone is capped by either an inversion of temperature or an isothermal layer at the tropopause. (Source: WHIT)

label: thermosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: ( some atmosphere) and ( some mesosphere)|atmospheric layer
definition: The thermosphere is a part of the earth's atmosphere that begins at about 50 miles (80 kilometers) above the earth's surface, extends to outer space, and is characterized by steadily increasing temperature with height

label: ozone layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some stratosphere|atmospheric layer|has increased levels of some
definition: The ozone layer is a layer of gases in the stratosphere which contains high concentrations of ozone gas relative to other parts of the atmosphere.

label: atmospheric layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmosphere| some gaseous environmental material
definition: A layer that is part of the atmosphere.

label: boundary layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some environmental system))| some surface layer|fluid interface layer
definition: A boundary layer is a layer of fluid in the immediate vicinity of a bounding surface where the effects of viscosity are significant enough to distort the surrounding non-viscous flow.

label: ionosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( some exosphere)| some ( some mesosphere)| some thermosphere|atmospheric layer
definition: The ionosphere is a layer of the Earth's atmosphere which extends from about 60 to 1,000 kilometers above the planetary surface and is ionised by solar radiation. It includes the thermosphere and parts of the mesosphere and exosphere.

label: exosphere
definition: The exosphere is an atmospheric layer where molecules are gravitationally bound to a planetary body, but where their density is too low for them to behave as a gas by colliding with each other. In the case of bodies with substantial atmospheres, such as Earth's atmosphere, the exosphere is the uppermost layer, where the atmosphere thins out and merges with interplanetary space. It is located directly above the thermosphere.

label: glaze ice layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some freezing rainfall| some water ice|water ice layer
definition: A glaze ice layer is a smooth, transparent and homogeneous ice layer which coats some surface and which is formed when freezing rain or drizzle hits that surface.

label: eutrophic lake
definition: A lake which has nutrient-rich water.

label: composting toilet
definition: A composting toilet fixture is a dry toilet fixture in which managed, aerobic decomposition converts human excreta into organic matter suitable for the fertilisation or amendment of soils.

label: paraffin oil
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some (CHEBI:16482 and CHEBI:18310)|ENVO:00002983|RO:0002473 some CHEBI:18310
definition: A fuel oil which is 1) composed primarily of alkanes having between 5-15 carbon atoms with the general formula CnH2n+2, 2) is generally odorless or has only a slight odor, 3) produces only small amounts of soot relative to other fuel oils, 4) is highly refined.

label: natural gas
definition: Natural gas is a hydrocarbon gas mixture consisting primarily of methane, but commonly includes varying amounts of other higher alkanes and sometimes a usually lesser percentage of carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and/or hydrogen sulfide. Natural gas is a fossil fuel formed when layers of buried plants and gases are exposed to intense heat and pressure over thousands of years.

label: liquefied petroleum gas
SYNONYMS: LP gas|LPG|liquid petroleum gas|liquified natural gas
definition: Liquified petroleum gas or liquid petroleum gas (LPG or LP gas), also referred to as simply propane or butane, are flammable mixtures of hydrocarbon gases used as fuel in heating appliances, cooking equipment, and vehicles.

label: hydrocarbon gas
definition: A gas that is primarily composed of hydrocarbon molecules.

label: compressed natural gas
definition: Compressed natural gas is a natural gas stored at high pressures, typically 2025 Megapascals.

label: biogas
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16183|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16526|ENVO:01000554|RO:0002473 some (CHEBI:16183 or CHEBI:16526)
definition: Biogas is a mixture of different gases produced by the breakdown of organic matter in the absence of oxygen,  is primarily composed of methane and carbon dioxide, and may have small amounts of hydrogen sulfide, water, and siloxanes.

label: liquefied natural gas
definition: Liquefied natural gas (LNG) is natural gas (predominantly methane, CH4) that has been converted to liquid form for ease of storage or transport. It takes up about 1/600th the volume of natural gas in the gaseous state. It is odorless, colorless, non-toxic and non-corrosive. LNG achieves a higher reduction in volume than compressed natural gas (CNG) so that the (volumetric) energy density of LNG is 2.4 times greater than that of CNG or 60 percent of that of diesel fuel.

label: compressed biogas
definition: Compressed biogas is biogas stored at increased pressures.

label: charcoal
definition: Charcoal is a light, black residue, consisting of carbon and any remaining ash, obtained by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and vegetation substances. Charcoal is usually produced by slow pyrolysis, the heating of wood or other substances in the absence of oxygen.

label: paraffin lamp
definition: A paraffin lamp is a type of lighting device which burns paraffin to generate light and heat.

label: flat-wick lamp
definition: A flat-wick lamp is a simple type of paraffin lamp, which burns paraffin drawn up through a wick by capillary action.

label: central-draught lamp
SYNONYMS: Argand lamp|central draught lamp|tubular round wick lamp
definition: A central-draught lamp is a paraffin lamp which burns a parrafin saturated, tubular wick contained between two structural tubes and supplied with oxygen by a central draught of air through the innermost of these tube.

label: mantle lamp
definition: A mantle lamp is a central-draught lamp which includes a pear-shaped, fabric mesh containing thorium or other rare-earth salts placed over the burner. On first use the fabric burns away and the rare-earth salts are converted to oxides, leaving a very fragile structure which incandesces (glows brightly) upon exposure to the heat of the burner flame.

label: lantern
definition: A lantern is a portable device or mounted fixture comprising a light source protected by a translucent case.

label: lamp
definition: A lamp is an object which generates heat, light, or any other form of radiation.

label: paraffin lantern
definition: A paraffin lantern is a lantern which houses a parrafin lamp in a structure of soldered or crimped-together sheet metal stampings and glass or other translucent material.

label: tubular paraffin lantern
definition: A tubular paraffin lantern is a paraffin lantern which includes metal tubes in its casing that direct air to the burning wick.

label: dead flame paraffin lantern
definition: A dead-flame paraffin lantern is a paraffin lantern which has a wick housed in a glass globe with airflow channelled upwards by vents below the burning wick and an open chimney above it.

label: hot-blast paraffin lantern
definition: A hot-blast paraffin lantern is a tubular paraffin lantern which collects hot air from the top of the lantern globe and circulates it, through metal tubes, to the burning wick.

label: cold-blast paraffin lantern
definition: A cold-blast paraffin lantern is a tubular paraffin lantern which collects cool air from around the top of the lantern globe and circulates it, through metal tubes, to the burning wick.

label: electric lamp
definition: An electric lamp is a lamp which produces light from electricity.

label: battery-powered electric lamp
definition: A battery-powered electric lamp is an electric lamp which draws its power from a device composed of two or more electrochemical cells that convert stored chemical energy into electrical energy.

label: candle
definition: A candle is a lamp composed of a wax within which an ignitable wick is embedded.

label: wax
definition: A wax is an environmental material which is primarily composed of lipids or other organic compounds that consist of long alkyl chains. Waxes are are malleable near ambient temperatures and melt at approximately 45 degrees Celsius.

label: apiary
subClassOf [LABEL]: some anthropogenic bee hive structure|agricultural ecosystem
definition: An apiary is a place where beehives of honey bees are kept and maintained by beekeepers.

label: radio device
definition: A device capable of receiving and/or transmitting information encoded in electromagnetic radiation through wave modulation.

label: cassette player
definition: A cassette deck is a device capable of playing and recording audio compact cassettes.

label: television set
definition: A television set is a device that combines a tuner, display, and loudspeakers for the purpose of converting digital or analog information signals into moving images and sound.

label: telephone
definition: A telephone is a telecommunications device which converts sound into electronic signals suitable for transmission via cables or other transmission media, and reconverts such signals into sound waves.

label: mobile phone
definition: A mobile phone is a telephone which transmits sound information to a mobile phone network via radio transmissions.

label: landline telephone
definition: A landline telephone is a telephone which is connected to a telephone network with wires through which electronic signals are carried.

label: refrigerator
definition: A refrigerator is a device which consists of a thermally insulated compartment and a mechanical, chemical, or electronic heat pump that transfers heat from the inside of the fridge to its external environment such that the inside of the fridge is cooled to a temperature below the ambient temperature of the room

label: table
definition: A table is a form of furniture with a flat horizontal upper surface used to support objects, for storage, show, and/or manipulation.

label: desk
definition: A desk is a table which is intended for information-manipulation tasks, including writing and use of interactive electronics.

label: chair
definition: A chair is a piece of furniture with a raised surface commonly used to seat a single person.

label: piece of furniture
definition: A piece of furniture is a movable object intended to support various human activities such as seating (e.g., chairs, stools and sofas) and sleeping (e.g., beds).

label: sofa
definition: A sofa is a bench which is partially or entirely upholstered, and often fitted with springs and tailored cushions.

label: bench
definition: A bench is a piece of furniture, on which several people may sit at the same time.

label: mattress
definition: A mattress is a mass of material which is able to cushion and support a reclining body and is used as or on a bed.

label: bed frame
definition: A bed frame is a piece of furniture which is used to position a mattress and bed base and may include a means of supporting a canopy.

label: bed base
definition: A bed base is a piece of furniture which supports a mattress.

label: framed bed
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (mattress and bed frame and bed base)|piece of furniture
definition: A framed bed is a piece of furniture which is composed of a mattress supported by a bed base and held in place by a bed frame.

label: cabinet
definition: A cabinet is a roughly cuboidal piece of furniture which is used to store miscellaneous items in compartments accessible through doors or drawers.

label: cupboard
definition: A cupboard is a cabinet which is used indoors to store household objects such as food, crockery, textiles and liquor, and to protect them from dust and dirt

label: clock
definition: A clock is an instrument which may indicate, keep, and/or co-ordinate time.

label: pressure lamp
definition: A pressure lamp is a portable paraffin or oil lamp in which fuel is forced up into the mantle or burner by air pressure in the reservoir, which can be increased by pumping with a plunger.

label: freshwater spring
definition: A spring through which fresh water flows.

label: rainwater
definition: Rainwater is liquid water which has precipitated in the form of droplets through the condensation of atmospheric water vapour.

label: motor vehicle
definition: A motor vehicle is a vehicle which is propelled by an engine or motor and that does not operate on rails.

label: truck
definition: A truck is a motor vehicle which, as its primary funcion, transports cargo rather than human passangers.

label: water truck
definition: A water truck is a truck which transports water.

label: vehicle
definition: A vehicle is a mobile machine which transports people or cargo.

label: car
definition: A car is a wheeled motor vehicle used primarily for the transportation of human passengers. Most definitions of the term specify that cars are designed to run primarily on roads, to have seating for one to eight people, to typically have four wheels, and to be constructed principally for the transport of people rather than goods.

label: cart
definition: A cart is a vehicle which has two wheels and is designed to transport human passengers or cargo.

label: animal-drawn cart
definition: An animal-drawn cart is a cart which is attached to one or more working or draught animals.

label: boat
definition: A boat is a watercraft of any size which is able to float or plane on water.

label: motor boat
definition: A motor boat is a boat which is propelled by a motor.

label: motor
definition: A motor is a machine designed to convert one or more forms of energy into mechanical energy.

label: bus
definition: A bus is a road vehicle designed to carry many passengers.

label: taxicab
definition: A taxicab is a car which may be hired, along with its operator, to transport passengers between locations of their choosing.

label: watercraft
definition: A watercraft is a vehicle which is able to travel on or through water.

label: bicycle
definition: A bicycle is a human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.

label: motorcycle
definition: A motorcycle is a two- or three-wheeled motor vehicle.

label: motorscooter
definition: A scooter or motor scooter is a motorcycle with step-through frame and a platform for the rider's feet.

label: lentic water body
definition: A lentic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, has very little to no directed flow.

label: lotic water body
definition: A lotic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, is flowing.

label: closed ecological system
definition: A closed ecological system is a vivarium which does not rely on matter exchange with any part outside the system.

label: mesocosm
definition: A mesocosm is a vivarium that is embedded within a natural environment and is used to place a relatively small part of that environment under experimental control for the purposes of scientific investigation.

label: microcosm
definition: A microcosm is a vivarium within which a simple ecosystem is artificially established and used to simulate and predict the behaviour of natural ecosystems under controlled conditions.

label: vapourisation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some (environmental material and ( some ))|material transformation process
definition: A material transformation process during which a liquid material transitions into a gas phase.

label: boiling
definition: Boiling is a form of vaporisation which occurs when a liquid is heated to a temperature at which the vapor pressure of the liquid is equal to the pressure exerted on the liquid by the surrounding environmental pressure.

label: hydrological condensation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric water vapour| some liquid water|condensation process
definition: Hydrological condensation is a process in which atmospheric water vapour undergoes a phase transition from the gas phase to the liquid phase.

label: manufactured cage
definition: A manufactured structure made of interspaced structural elements such as metal or wooden bars or wires held together such that they may be used to confine, contain, or protect something.

label: drylot
definition: A drylot is an enclosure of limited size usually bare of vegetation and used for fattening livestock.

label: feedlot
definition: A feedlot is a plot of land on which livestock are fattened for market

label: plant litter
definition: Leaf litter is dead plant material, such as leaves, bark, needles, and twigs, that has fallen to the ground.

label: climate change
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (climate system and ( some ))| some climate system|environmental system process
definition: The long-term fluctuations in temperature, precipitation, wind, and all other aspects of the Earth's climate. External processes, such as solar-irradiance variations, variations of the Earth's orbital parameters (eccentricity, precession, and inclination), lithosphere motions, and volcanic activity, are factors in climatic variation. Internal variations of the climate system, e.g., changes in the abundance of greenhouse gases, also may produce fluctuations of sufficient magnitude and variability to explain observed climate change through the feedback processes interrelating the components of the climate system.

label: acidification of an aquatic environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ((water body or aquatic biome or aquatic environment) and ( some (liquid water and ( some ))))| some (water body or aquatic biome or aquatic environment)|environmental system process
definition: Acidification of an aquatic environment is a process whereby the pH of an aquatic environment, biome, or water body is lowered.

label: ocean acidification
subClassOf [LABEL]: ( some (ocean or sea)) and ( some ((ocean or sea) and ( some (ocean water and ( some )))))|acidification of an aquatic environment
definition: Ocean acidification is a process during which the pH of a sea or ocean is lowered.

label: chonolith
definition: A chonolith is an igneous rock intrusion of irregular shape with a demonstrable base, absent in other types of irregularly-shaped intrusions.

label: ecosystem-wide aerobic respiration
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some GO:0009060|ENVO:02500008|RO:0002233 some ((CHEBI:15379 and (RO:0000087 some CHEBI:17654)) and (CHEBI:16646 and (RO:0000087 some CHEBI:33284)))|RO:0002234 some (CHEBI:16526 and ENVO:00002006)
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some ( and liquid water)| some (( and ( some )) and ( and ( some )))|ecosystem-wide respiration
definition: A process which consists of all aerobic respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: volcanic eruption
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some | some | some | some (lava or tephra or (environmental material and ( some )))| some magma| some planetary crust| some volcano| some water vapour|material transport process
definition: A volcanic eruption is a process during which lava, tephra (ash, lapilli, volcanic bombs and blocks), and assorted gases are expelled from a volcanic vent or fissure.

label: planetary landmass
subClassOf [LABEL]: some planet| some solid environmental material|landmass|surrounded by some (not (environmental material and ( some )))
definition: A landmass which is part of a planet.

label: liquid planetary surface
subClassOf [LABEL]: liquid surface of an astronomical body
SYNONYMS: A liquid planetary surface is a planetary surface layer where a liquid material of a planet comes into contact with atmosphere or outer space.

label: outer space
definition: Outer space is a hard vacuum containing a low density of particles, predominantly a plasma of hydrogen and helium as well as electromagnetic radiation, magnetic fields, neutrinos, dust and cosmic rays that exists between celestial bodies.

label: planetary crust
definition: A planetary crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet or natural satellite, which is chemically distinct from the underlying mantle.

label: planetary structural layer
definition: A planetary structural layer is laminar part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density. Planetary layers have differing physicochemical properties and composition.

label: planetary mantle
definition: A planetary mantle is a planetary layer which is an interior part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density.

label: planetary core
definition: A planetary core is the innermost structural layer or layers of a planet. The core may be entirely liquid, entirely solid, or have both liquid and solid parts.

label: liquid planetary core
definition: A liquid planetary core is a planetary core which is primarily composed of liquid material.

label: solid planetary core
definition: A solid planetary core is a planetary core which is primarily composed of solid material.

label: lithosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some ( some (planetary mantle and ( some )))| some planetary crust| some solid environmental material|planetary structural layer
definition: A lithosphere is the outermost shell of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite that is defined by its rigid mechanical properties.

label: asthenosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some lithosphere|planetary structural layer
definition: An asthenosphere is a layer of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite which is highly viscous, mechanically weak, and ductilely deforming.

label: magma
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some (environmental material and ( some ))| some planetary structural layer|environmental material
definition: Magma is a mixture of molten or semi-molten rock, volatiles, and solids that is found beneath the uppermost solid layer of a planetary body. Besides molten rock, magma may also contain suspended crystals, dissolved gas and sometimes gas bubbles.

label: trench
definition: A trench is a type of excavation or depression in the ground that is generally deeper than it is wide (as opposed to a wider gully or ditch), and narrow compared to its length (as opposed to a simple hole).

label: stream channel
definition: A channel of a watercourse which contains a stream.

label: ocean strait
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean water and (connects some (ocean or sea)))|strait
definition: An ocean strait is a strait which connects two oceans.

label: river channel
definition: A stream channel which contains a river.

label: slum
subClassOf [LABEL]: some city| some urban biome|dense settlement
definition: A slum is a heavily populated urban informal settlement with substandard housing in which households lack any one of the following: access to improved water, access to improved sanitation, sufficient-living area, durability of housing, or security of tenure.

label: undersea trough
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean floor or sea floor)| some (ocean or sea)|trough
definition: An undersea trough is a trough which is below a marine water body.

label: explosive eruption
definition: An explosive eruption is a volcanic process in which pressurised magma is violently expelled and froths into volcanic ash. Explosive eruptions can eject a cloud of rocks, dust, gas, and pyroclastic material  which may then collapse, creating a pyroclastic flow of hot volcanic matter.

label: effusive eruption
subClassOf [LABEL]: some lava| some lava flow process| some magma|volcanic eruption
definition: An effusive eruption is a volcanic eruption during which lava flows onto the ground.

label: igneous intrusion process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some igneous intrusion| some magma|rock-precursor intrusion process
definition: A process whereby rising magma cools and solidifies without reaching the surface. Instead, the cooled and solidified igneous mass crystallises within the crust to form an igneous intrusion.

label: dense settlement
definition: A settlement with a high density of buildings and inhabitants.

label: igneous intrusion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some igneous rock| some mineral material|rock intrusion
definition: An igneous intrusion is a mass of rock and minerals formed when magma cools, solidifies, and undergoes fractional crystallisation without reaching the surface.

label: tephra
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some explosive eruption|solid environmental material
definition: Tephra is fragmental material produced by a volcanic eruption regardless of composition, fragment size or emplacement mechanism.

label: tuff
definition: Tuff is a type of rock made of volcanic ash ejected from a vent during a volcanic eruption.

label: scoria
definition: Scoria is a highly vesicular, dark colored volcanic rock that may or may not contain crystals.

label: pumice
definition: Pumice is a volcanic rock that consists of highly vesicular rough textured volcanic glass, which may or may not contain crystals.

label: tuff cone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ash cone| some tuff|volcanic cone
definition: A cone that is composed of consolidated volcanic ash.

label: waste role
definition: A role that is realized in some process wherein the bearer is discarded or not utilized further.

label: area of open water
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric boundary layer| some planetary surface| some water body|fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of water in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: geological fracture
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))|solid astronomical body part
definition: A geological fracture is any separation in a geologic formation, such as a joint or a fault that divides a mass of rock into two or more pieces.

label: geological fault
definition: A geological fault is a planar fracture or discontinuity in a volume of rock, across which there has been significant displacement as a result of rock mass movement.

label: active geological fault
definition: An active fault is a fault that is likely to become the source of another earthquake sometime in the future. Geologists commonly consider faults to be active if there has been movement observed or evidence of seismic activity during the last 10,000 years.

label: vein
definition: A vein is a geological fracture which is filled with minerals precipitated out of an aqueous solution.

label: dike
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (igneous rock or sedimentary rock)|rock intrusion
definition: A sheet of rock that formed in a fracture in a pre-existing rock body.

label: geological joint
definition: A joint is a geological fracture which has no measureable shear displacement

label: shear fracture
definition: A geological fracture across which shear displacement has occurred

label: microfracture
definition: A microfracture is a small fracture which is found in a portion of solid material along which further fracturing tends to occur. Microfractures are considered imperfections which to pre-exist any fractures formed by the application of stress to a material.

label: atmospheric column
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some atmosphere| some outer space| some planetary surface|fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: A fiat part of an atmosphere which is defined as a vertical, three-dimensional pillar extending from a unit area on a planetary surface and bounded by the top of the atmosphere.

label: contaminated air
subClassOf [LABEL]: air|has increased levels of some ( and ( some ))
definition: Contaminated air is air which has sufficient concentrations of environmental pollutants such that it may adversely affect a given ecosystem.

label: earthquake
definition: An earthquake is a process during which energy is released in an astronomical body's crust, causing the displacement of crustal parts and the generation of seismic waves.

label: tectonic earthquake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some active geological fault| some structural collapse process| some tectonic movement|earthquake
definition: An earthquake caused by the sudden release of energy accumulated in an astronomical body's crust, as the elastic strain placed on constituent rock masses causes them to fracture.

label: megathrust earthquake
definition: A megathrust earthquake is a tectonic earthquake which occurs at subduction zones at destructive plate boundaries (convergent boundaries). These interplate earthquakes are the planet's most powerful, with moment magnitudes that can exceed 9.0.

label: polluted lake
definition: A lake which has concentrations of environmental contaminants high enough to harm the ecosystems associated with it.

label: sodium chloride salt
definition: A mineral material composed primarily of sodium chloride.

label: glacial abrasion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some rock|glacial erosion process
definition: A glacial abrasion process is an erosional process during which debris in the basal ice scrapes along the bed, polishing and gouging the underlying rocks, similar to sandpaper on wood.

label: glacial plucking
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some rock|glacial erosion process
definition: Glacial plucking is an erosional process during which pieces of bedrock are cracked off due to the mechanical force of a moving glacier.

label: glacial ice thrusting
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some sediment|glacial erosion process
definition: Glacial ice thrusting is an erosional process during which a moving glacier which has frozen to its bed surges forward and moves large sheets of sediment frozen to the glacial mass.

label: water mass
definition: A mass of water.

label: marine water mass
definition: A mass of marine water.

label: coast
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean or sea or lake)| some planetary landmass
definition: A coast is the area where land meets the sea, ocean, or lake.

label: lake coast
definition: The general region of indefinite width that extends from a lake inland to the first major change in terrain features.

label: tsunami
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean or sea or lake)|mass liquid flow
definition: A tsunami is a process during which a series of waves is generated in a water body, typically an ocean or large lake, by the displacement of a large volume of water. Earthquakes, volcanic eruptions and other underwater explosions (including detonations of underwater nuclear devices), landslides, glacier calvings, meteorite impacts and other disturbances above or below water all have the potential to generate a tsunami.

label: mass wasting
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some material accumulation process| some material decumulation process| some slope|material transport process
definition: Mass wasting is the geomorphic process by which solid environmental material such as soil, sand, regolith, and/or rock move downslope typically as a mass, largely under the force of gravity, but frequently affected by water and water content as in submarine environments and mudslides.

label: avalanche
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some snow))|mass wasting flow
definition: A mass wasting flow during which snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: landslide process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (scree or rock or soil or sediment or mud or sand)|mass wasting
definition: A landslide is a process whereby a large mass of earth and rocks moves down a hill or a mountainside.

label: geological subsidence
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (submerged bed or planetary landmass)|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a geological surface shifts downward relative to a datum such as sea-level.

label: mudslide
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some mud))|mass wasting

label: mass wasting flow
definition: A mass wasting flow is a form of mass wasting during which the moving materials behave similarly to a flowing fluid. Water, air and ice are often involved in enabling fluidlike motion of the material.

label: mudflow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and (has increased levels of some (liquid water and (clay or mud))))|mass wasting flow
definition: A mudflow is a form of mass wasting which involves very rapid to extremely rapid surging flow of debris that has become partially or fully liquified by the addition of significant amounts of water to clay-rich source material.

label: debris flow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some rock| some soil| some stream channel| some valley|mass wasting flow
definition: A mass wasting flow during which water-laden masses of soil and fragmented rock rush down the slopes of elevations, funnel into stream channels, entrain objects in their paths, and form thick, muddy deposits on valley floors.

label: lahar
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and (has increased levels of some (volcanic rock or tephra or tuff or volcanic soil)))| some (volcano or volcanic cone)|mudflow
definition: A lahar is a type of mudflow or debris flow composed of a slurry of pyroclastic material, rocky debris, and water. The material flows down from a volcano, typically along a river valley.

label: sturzstrom
definition: A sturzstrom is a landslide consisting which has a great amount of kinetic energy resulting in greater horizontal movement when compared to its initial vertical drop  as much as 20 or 30 times the vertical distance. By contrast a normal landslide will typically travel a horizontal distance that is less than twice the distance that the material has fallen.

label: volcanic ash
definition: Volcanic ash is an environmental material which consists of fragments of pulverized rock, minerals, and volcanic glass, created during volcanic eruptions and measuring less than 2 millimetres in diameter. Volcanic ash is formed during explosive volcanic eruptions, phreatomagmatic eruptions and during transport in pyroclastic density currents.

label: ash fall process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( some volcanic eruption)| some (water body or atmosphere)| some planetary surface| some tephra| some volcanic ash|precipitation process
definition: An ash fall process is a process in which volcanic ash formed during an explosive volcanic eruption, phreatomagmatic eruption, or during material transport in pyroclastic density currents is pulled towards the planetary surface by gravity.

label: hydrological precipitation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ((environmental material and ( some )) and ( some hydrological condensation process))|precipitation process
definition: Hydrological precipitation is a process during which any product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapour is pulled to the planetary surface by gravity.

label: hydrological evaporation
definition: Hydrological evaporation is the evaporation of water, generally as part of a planetary water cycle.

label: soil degradation
definition: Soil degradation is a process which results in a change in soil health status resulting in a diminished capacity of the ecosystem in which the soil occurs to provide goods and services for its  beneficiaries.

label: soil erosion
definition: Soil erosion is a process in which exogenic processes remove soil from one location on the Earth's crust and transport it to another location where it is deposited.

label: coastal flooding
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean or sea or lake)| some coast|flooding
definition: Coastal flooding is a process in which normally dry, low-lying land near a coast is flooded by sea water.

label: riverine flooding
definition: Riverine flooding is a process in which the flow rate of river water exceeds the capacity of its channel, thus flooding neighbouring land. Bends and meanders in a river channel are particularly disposed to such flooding.

label: flash flooding
definition: Flash flooding is a process in which low-lying land is inundated with water for a short period of time and are usually the result of precipitation or a breach in the container of a water body.

label: flood
definition: An unusual accumulation of water above the ground caused by high tide, heavy rain, melting snow or rapid runoff from paved areas.

label: coastal flood
definition: A coastal flood is a flood which is formed as a result of large amounts of water from marine water bodies or large lakes being transported to usually dry land by displacement processes such as high winds or seismic activity.

label: riverine flood
definition: A riverine flood is a flood which is formed as a result of a river's flow rate exceeding the capacity of its channel.

label: flash flood
definition: A flash flood is a flood formed by the rapid flooding of geomorphic low-lying areas. It may be caused by heavy rain associated with a severe thunderstorm, hurricane, tropical storm, or meltwater from ice or snow flowing over ice sheets or snowfields. Flash floods may also occur after the collapse of a natural ice or debris dam, or a human structure such as a man-made dam. Flash floods are distinguished from a regular flood by a timescale of less than six hours.

label: storm surge
definition: A storm surge is a coastal flood which is caused by low-pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: meteotsunami
definition: A meteotsunami is a tsunami caused by atmospheric processes and differences in air pressure.

label: storm surge process
definition: A storm surge process is a coastal flooding process which is caused by low pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: areal flooding
definition: Areal flooding is a flooding process in which flat or low-lying areas become inundated with water due to water input exceeding infiltration, evaporation, or run off.

label: urban flooding
definition: Urban flooding is a flooding process in which land or property in a built environment, particularly in more densely populated areas, is inundated due to the rate of water input exceeding that of water drainage provided by the environment's drainage systems.

label: snowmelt
subClassOf [LABEL]: some fresh water| some snow|hydrological melting process
definition: Snowmelt is a hydrological melting process in which water is produced by the melting of snow and becomes part of the hydrological surface runoff.

label: hydrological melting process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (liquid water and ( some ))| some (liquid water and ( some ))| some thawing process|melting
definition: A melting process during which water-based ice, snow, or other solid phase water transitions into a liquid phase.

label: icemelt
subClassOf [LABEL]: some fresh water| some water ice|hydrological melting process
definition: Icemelt is a hydrological melthing process in which water is produced by the melting of ice and becomes part of the hydrological surface runoff.

label: meltwater
definition: Meltwater is the water released by the melting of snow or ice, including glacial ice, tabular icebergs and ice shelves over oceans.

label: melting
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some (environmental material and ( some ))|material transformation process
definition: Melting is a material transformation process which results in the phase transition of a substance from a solid to a liquid.

label: condensation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some (environmental material and ( some ))|material congelation process
definition: Condensation is a process during which a gas undergoes a phase transition into a liquid.

label: chemical precipitation process
definition: Chemical precipitation is a process in which a portion of some solid substance segregates from a material in which that substance or its precursors were dissolved in and settles due to a force such as gravity or centrifugal force. Segregation may occur due to the solubility limits of the precipitating substance being exceeded or due to a chemical reaction that forms a solid product from aqueous reagents.

label: desublimation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some (environmental material and ( some ))|material congelation process
definition: Desublimation is a process in which a portion of some gas undergoes a phase transition into a portion of some solid.

label: sublimation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some (environmental material and ( some ))|material transformation process
definition: A material transformation process during which a solid material transitions into a gas phase.

label: tectonic uplift process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (submerged bed or planetary landmass)|tectonic movement
definition: A tectonic uplift process is a geomorphologic process in which a geological surface shifts upward relative to a datum such as sea-level due to forces other than isostatic responses to unloading.

label: atmospheric subsidence
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (air and ( some atmosphere))| some katabatic wind|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a mass of air moves through an atmosphere towards a planetary surface.

label: lava flow process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some lava| some planetary landmass|mass liquid flow
definition: A process in which a volume of lava emitted during an effusive eruption moves along a solid surface.

label: igneous extrusion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some igneous rock| some volcanic eruption|surface landform
definition: A mass of igneous rock formed when hot magma flows out (extrudes) onto a planetary surface as lava or explodes violently into the atmosphere to fall back as pyroclastics or tuff.

label: clastic dike
definition: A dike formed when sediment fills a pre-existing fracture in a mass of rock.

label: stock
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (igneous intrusion process and planetary erosion)| some igneous rock|rock intrusion
definition: A stock is a discordant igneous intrusion having a surface exposure of less than 100 square kilometres. Stocks differ from batholiths only in being smaller.

label: laccolith
definition: A sheet intrusion (or concordant pluton) that has been injected between two layers of sedimentary rock. The pressure of the magma is high enough that the overlying strata are forced upward, giving the laccolith a dome or mushroom-like form with a generally planar base.

label: lopolith
definition: A large igneous intrusion which is lenticular in shape with a depressed central region.

label: phacolith
definition: A phacolith is an intrusion parallel to the bedding plane or foliation of folded country rock. More specifically, it is a typically lens-shaped intrusion that occupies either the crest of an anticline or the trough of a syncline.

label: sill
definition: A tabular sheet intrusion that has intruded between older layers of sedimentary rock, beds of volcanic lava or tuff, or along the direction of foliation in metamorphic rock.

label: rock-precursor intrusion process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (sediment or lava or magma)| some rock|material transport process
definition: A process whereby the precursors of rock, such as magma or sedimentary particles, fill a fracture in a mass of rock.

label: habitat
definition: An environmental system which can sustain and allow the growth of an ecological population.

label: area of perennial water ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (planetary surface and ( some water ice))| some atmospheric boundary layer|area of perennial ice or snow
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of water ice, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: waste recycling process
definition: A process during which materials deemed as waste are separated and converted into a form which can be used as input by the same processes which generated them.

label: carbon-bearing gas emission process
subClassOf [LABEL]: ( some ) and ( some ( some ))|hydrocarbon gas emission process
definition: A carbon emission process is any environmental process which outputs a carbon-bearing gas.

label: land consumption process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (anthropogenic terrestrial biome or anthropogenic environment)| some (land conversion process or land degradation)| some natural environment| some planetary landmass|anthropisation
definition: A process in which natural ecosystems present over an expanse of land are removed and replaced with anthropogenic ecosystems.

label: human dwelling
subClassOf [LABEL]: some usage of an environment for residential activity|domestic building
definition: A self-contained constructed feature used by one or more households as a home, such as a house, apartment, mobile home, houseboat or other 'substantial' structure. A dwelling typically includes nearby outbuildings, sheds etc. within the curtilage of the property, excluding any 'open fields beyond'. It has significance in relation to search and seizure, conveyancing of real property, burglary, trespass, and land use planning.

label: area of perennial snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (planetary surface and ( some snow))| some area of perennial ice or snow| some atmospheric boundary layer| some planetary surface|area of perennial ice or snow
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of snow, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of perennial ice or snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (planetary surface and ( some (snow or ice)))| some atmospheric boundary layer|fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of snow or water ice, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: regolith
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (piece of rock or soil)| some dust| some planetary crust|solid layer
definition: A solid layer which is composed primarily of loose, heterogeneous, superficial material covering solid rock.

label: continental crust
definition: A layer of igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks that forms continents and the areas of shallow seabed close to their shores, known as continental shelves.

label: oceanic crust
definition: Oceanic crust is the uppermost layer of the oceanic portion of a tectonic plate.

label: Mohorovicic discontinuity
definition: The Mohorovicic discontinuity, usually referred to as the Moho, is the boundary between the Earth's crust and the mantle, indicating a change in composition.

label: bedrock
definition: A lithified mass of rock that lies under the loose softer material (regolith) at the surface of the Earth or other terrestrial planet.

label: area of barren land
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric boundary layer| some planetary surface|terrestrial environmental zone
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of bedrock, desert pavement, scarp rock, talus, material exposed by slides, volcanic material, glacial debris, sand, material exposed during strip mining, gravel, and other accumulations of earthen material in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: obsolete air temperature
