definition: A water accumulation process which results in the formation of an ocean by the outgassing, capture, and subsequent condensation of water vapour during the formation of an astronomical body.

label: microbial cell culture
definition: A cell culture which supports the growth and proliferation of microorganisms.

label: bacterial cell culture
definition: A microbial cell culture which is primarily composed of bacterial biomass.

label: archaeal cell culture
definition: A microbial cell culture which is primarily composed of archaeal biomass.

label: cell culture of eukaryotic microbes
definition: A microbial cell culture which is primarily composed of eukaryotic biomass.

label: spacecraft
definition: A vehicle designed to fly in outer space.

label: water-holding capacity
definition: A disposition of a material entity which is realised when it is saturated with liquid water.

label: particle
subClassOf [LABEL]: some particulate environmental material|mass of solid material|surrounded by some (gaseous environmental material or liquid environmental material)
definition: A mass of solid material which is either 1) a minute fragment of a larger mass or 2) one of a collection of small masses composing an aggregate.

label: particle of clay
subClassOf [LABEL]: ( some clay) or (derives from part of some clay)|particle
definition: A particle which 1) is composed primarily of hydrous aluminium phyllosilicate minerals, in turn composed of aluminium and silicon ions bonded into tiny, thin plates by interconnecting oxygen and hydroxide ions, and 2) is or was part of a portion of clay.

label: day
definition: A one-dimensional temporal region which spans the duration an astronomical body completes one rotation on its axis.

label: rainy day
definition: A day during which water-based rainfall occurs.

label: percolation of water through soil
definition: Percolation during which water moves through the interstices of soil.

label: percolation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some fluid environmental material|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a fluid is filtered through porous soild or semi-solid materials.

label: drainage process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some liquid environmental material|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a liquid which is not absorbed or otherwise held in place by a material is transported away from its location.

label: convective transport process
definition: A material transport process which arises spontaneously due to physical heterogeneities in a portion of a material and forces which act throughout its volume.

label: convective
definition: A physical quality of a process which is characteristic of processes that transport material within a volume due to the combined effects of material property heterogeneity and body forces across that volume.

label: advective
definition: A physical quality of a process which is characteristic of process that transport material without, themselves, changing the qualities of those materials or the processes that are unfolding within them.

label: material diffusion process
definition: A material transport process during which material moves from a region of higher concentration to a region of lower concentration.

label: irradiation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some radiation| some surface layer|energy transfer process
definition: An energy transfer process during which a material entity receives energy through radiation.

label: irradiation by ionizing radiation
definition: Irradiation during which a material entity receives energy through ionizing radiation.

label: irradiation by non-ionizing radiation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (shortwave radiation or photosynthetically active radiation or microwave radiation or radio wave radiation or infrared radiation or visible spectrum radiation)|irradiation
definition: Irradiation during which a material entity receives energy through non-ionizing radiation.

label: irradiation by photosynthetically active radiation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some photosynthetically active radiation|irradiation by non-ionizing radiation
definition: Irradiation during which a material entity receives energy through photosynthetically active radiation.

label: electromagnetic wave energy
definition: Wave energy which inheres in perpendicular electric and magnetic fields and which is realised when they oscillate and propagate.

label: wave energy
definition: Energy which inheres in a wave and is realised during its propagation.

label: fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: A part of an environmental system whose boundaries are determined by fiat.

label: area of high atmospheric pressure
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (gaseous environmental material and ( some ))|gaseous part of an atmosphere
definition: A gaseous part of an atmosphere in which gases have increased atmospheric pressure.

label: hypodermic needle
definition: A hypodermic needle is a medical instrument made from a hollow needle. It is commonly used with a syringe to inject substances into the body of an organism.

label: textile
definition: A textile is a manufactured product comprised of a network of natural or artificial fibers (often referred to as thread or yarn).

label: bedclothing
definition: Bedclothing is a textile covering used on a bed as a sheet, blanket, or pillowcase.

label: pockmark field
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine pockmark| some sea floor|field
definition: A pockmark field is an undersea feature formed by shallow seabed depressions, typically several tens of metres across and a few metres deep. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: nesting material
definition: Nesting material is an animal habitation consisting of matierals used to cushion, insulate and protect the young of the organism. The adult will use the material to form a protective structure to house and raise their young. Nests are built primarily by birds, but also by mammals, fish, insects and reptiles.

label: obsolete livestock-associated habitat
definition: Livestock is an animal-associated habitat consisting of any domestic or domesticated animal intentionally raised for food or in the production of food or raised as stock to produce food or fibre, in an agricultural setting or for its labour or pen-raised animals raised on licensed game farm operations. Livestock include: bovine animals (including buffalo and bison), ovine animals, porcine animals, caprine animals, , poultry, bees, equine animals, cervidae animals; animals of the genus Lama; ratites (Emu, Ostrich, and Rhea), fish or shellfish in aquaculture facilities, and enclosed domesticated rabbits or hares raised for human food or fiber.

label: obsolete cultured habitat
definition: Cultured habitat is an controlled habitat created by humans through laboratory techniques usually for the purposes of preparing cell, organ, tissue and plant tissue cultures.

label: tissue culture
definition: Tissue culture is the culture of cells, tissues or organs in a nutrient medium under sterile conditions.

label: cell culture
definition: Organic material which is composed primarily of a growth of cells in an artificial medium for experimental research.

label: plant tissue culture
definition: Plant tissue culture is the growth or maintenance of plant cells, tissues, organs or whole plants in vitro.

label: organ culture
definition: Organ culture is the aseptic culture of complete living organs of animals and plants outside the body in a suitable culture medium. Animal organs must be small enough to allow the nutrients in the culture medium to penetrate all the cells.

label: bodily fluid material
definition: An organic material which is primarily composed of some natural bodily fluid or secretion such as blood, semen, saliva, blood plasma, intracellular and interstitial fluids.

label: blood material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of blood, a bodily fluid composed of blood plasma and blood cells suspended within the plasma that circulates around the organism's body. Blood performs may important functions including the supplying of oxygen and nutrients, removal of waste, circulation of white blood cells, detection of antibodes, coagulation, transportation of antibodies and the regulation of pH and body temperature.

label: amniotic fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of amniotic fluid, a bodily fluid consisting of watery liquid surrounding and cushioning a growing fetus within the amnion. It allows the fetus to move freely without the walls of the uterus being too tight against its body. Buoyancy is also provided.

label: excreta material
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some waste role|bodily fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of excreta, bodily fluids consisting of matter which contains the waste products of biological processes, including urine or feces, discharged from an organism's body.

label: bile material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of bile, a bodily fluid consisting of a bitter, yellow or green alkaline fluid secreted by hepatocytes from the liver of most vertebrates. In many species, bile is stored in the gallbladder between meals and upon eating is discharged into the duodenum where the bile aids the process of digestion of lipids.

label: aqueous humour material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of aqueous humour, a bodily fluid consisting of a thick watery substance that fills the space between the lens and the cornea.

label: sweat material
definition: An excreta material which is composed primarily of sweat, an excreta consisting primarily of water as well as a smaller amount of sodium chloride that is excreted by the sweat glands in the skin of mammals.

label: chyme material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of chyme, a bodily fluid consisting of a liquid substance found in the stomach before passing through the pyloric valve and entering the duodenum. It results from the mechanical and chemical breakdown of a bolus and consists of partially digested food, water, hydrochloric acid, and various digestive enzymes.

label: blood plasma material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of blood plasma, a bodily fluid that comprises the liquid component of blood, in which the blood cells are suspended. It makes up about 55% of total blood volume.

label: ear wax material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of ear wax, a bodily fluid consisting of a yellowish, waxy substance secreted in the ear canal of humans and many other mammals. It plays an important role in the human ear canal, assisting in cleaning and lubrication, and also provides some protection from bacteria, fungi, and insects.

label: cerebrospinal fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of cerebrospinal fluid, a clear bodily fluid that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain. CSF is a clear bodily fluid that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain.

label: chyle material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of chyle, a bodily fluid consisting of a milky fluid consisting of lymph and emulsified fats; formed in the small intestine during digestion of ingested fats.

label: breast milk material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of breast milk, is a bodily fluid produced that is secreted from two milk-secreting glandular organs on a female's chest.

label: vitreous humor material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of vitreous humor, a bodily fluid consisting of a clear gel that fills the space between the lens and the retina of the eyeball of humans and other vertebrates.

label: pleural effusion material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of a pleural effusion, a bodily fluid that is produced in excess and accumulates in the pleural cavity, the fluid-filled space that surrounds the lungs. Excessive amounts of such fluid can impair breathing by limiting the expansion of the lungs during inhalation.

label: tear material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of a volume of tears, a bodily fluid consisting of a drop of the clear salty liquid secreted by glands (lacrimal glands) in the eyes. Tears wet the membrane covering the eye and help rid the eye of irritating substances.

label: oronasal secretion material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of an oronasal secretion, a bodily fluid secreted from the body via the mouth or nose.

label: saliva material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of saliva, a slightly alkaline secretion of water, mucin, protein, salts, and often a starch-splitting enzyme (as ptyalin) that is secreted into the mouth by salivary glands, lubricates ingested food, and often begins the breakdown of starches.

label: sebum material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of sebum, an oily bodily fluid secreted from the sebaceous glads that is made of fat (lipids) and the debris of dead fat-producing cells. In the glands, sebum is produced within specialized cells and is released as these cells burst. Sebum acts to protect and waterproof hair and skin, and keep them from becoming dry, brittle and cracked. It can also inhibit the growth of microorganisms on skin.

label: pus material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of pus, a bodily fluid consisting of a whitish-yellow or yellow substance produced during inflammatory responses of the body that can be found in regions of pyogenic bacterial infections. Pus is produced from the dead and living cells which travel into the intercellular spaces around the affected cells.

label: synovial fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of synovial fluid, a bodily fluid secreted by the synovial membrane into the joint cavity to form a thin layer at the surface of cartilage.

label: mucus material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of mucus, a bodily fluid consisting of a slippery secretion of the lining of the mucous membranes in the body. It is a viscous colloid containing antiseptic enzymes (such as lysozyme) and immunoglobulins. Mucus is produced by goblet cells in the mucous membranes that cover the surfaces of the membranes. It is made up of mucins and inorganic salts suspended in water.

label: lymph material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of lymph, a bodily fluid consisting of a usually clear coagulable fluid that passes from intercellular spaces of body tissue into the lymphatic vessels, is discharged into the blood by way of the thoracic duct and right lymphatic duct, and resembles blood plasma in containing white blood cells and especially lymphocytes but normally few red blood cells and no platelets.

label: interstitial fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of interstitial fluid, a bodily fluid consisting of a solution which bathes and surrounds the cells of multicellular animals. It is the main component of the extracellular fluid, which also includes plasma and transcellular fluid.

label: biological product
definition: A biological product is an environmental substrate comprised of any virus, therapeutic serum, toxin, antitoxin, or analogous product available to prevent, treat or cure diseases or injuries in man.

label: siliceous ooze
definition: Siliceous ooze is a marine sediment composed of the debris of plankton with silica shells, such as diatoms and radiolaria. This ooze is limited to areas with high biological productivity, such as the polar oceans, and upwelling zones near the equator. The least common type of sediment, it covers only 15% of the ocean floor. It accumulates at a slower rate than calcareous ooze: 0.2-1 cm / 1000 yr.

label: red clay
definition: Red clay, also known as pelagic clay, accumulates in the deepest and most remote areas of the ocean. Containing less than 30% biogenic material, its composition is a varied mix of very fine quartz and clay minerals, authigenic deposits precipitated directly from seawater, and micrometeorites. Though called "red" because it sometimes takes the color of oxidized iron minerals, it is usually brownish in color. Its ultimate origin is uncertain, but red clay seems to be mostly derived from distant rivers, and windblown dust. Covering 38% of the ocean floor, it accumulates more slowly than any other sediment type, at only 0.1-0.5 cm / 1000 yr.

label: calcareous ooze
definition: Calcareous ooze is a marine sediment composed primarily of the shells--also known as tests--of foraminifera, coccolithophores, and pteropods. This is the most common pelagic sediment by area, covering 48% of the world ocean's floor. This type of ooze is limited to depths above the Carbonate Compensation Depth at time of burial. It accumulates more rapidly than any other pelagic sediment type, with a rate that varies from 0.3 - 5 cm / 1000 yr.

label: animal feed
definition: Food material which can be used to meet nutritional requirements of animals, particularly livestock such as cattle, goats, sheep, horses, chickens and pigs.

label: contaminated animal feed
definition: Contaminated animal feed is an animal feed that has become contaminated with or come contact with microorganisms or toxic chemicals.

label: coastal water body
definition: A lentic water body which is adjacent to a coast.

label: obsolete unpasteurized milk product
definition: Raw milk which has not undergone the pasteurization process.

label: umbrella
definition: A canopy designed to protect against precipitation or sunlight.

label: hide
definition: A skin obtained from animals for human use typically from deer or cattle sources used to produce leather, shoes, fashion accessories, musical instruments.

label: bone meal
definition: A mixture of crushed and coarsely ground bones that is used as an organic fertilizer for plants and formerly in animal feed.

label: plant feed
definition: Food material which can be used to meet nutritional requirements of plants.

label: cloth
definition: A textile comprised of a pliable material made usually by weaving, felting, or knitting natural or synthetic fibers and filaments.

label: surface soil
definition: A soil consisting of the upper layer of soil on the surface consisting of loose material capable of supporting life composed of a mixture of mineral and organic matter.

label: letter
definition: A written message from one person to another addressed to a person or organization.

label: ash
definition: An environmental material that is the non-aqueous, non-gaseous residues that remain after something is burned.

label: coal
definition: A combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock usually occurring in rock strata in layers or veins called coal beds or coal seams.

label: ore
definition: a type of rock that contains sufficient minerals with important elements including metals that can be economically extracted from the rock.

label: uranium ore
definition: Ore which contains uranium.

label: coal dust
definition: Dust which is derived from coal.

label: mineral dust
definition: Dust which is derived from mineral material.

label: fibrous dust
definition: Dust which is composed of fibrous material.

label: metallic dust
definition: Dust which is composed primarily of some metallic material.

label: clay dust
definition: Dust which is derived from clay material.

label: grain dust
definition: Dust that comes from grain and all the other substances associated with its cultivation & harvesting.

label: open-pit mine
definition: A surface mine that utilizes a technique of extracting rock or minerals from the earth by their removal from an open pit or borrow.

label: fume
definition: A gas, smoke, or vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale.

label: vanadium fume
definition: Respirable vapor of vanadium.

label: natural wax
definition: A wax that is naturally synthesized by a plant or animal.

label: paraffin wax
definition: A white or colourless soft solid derivable from petroleum, coal or oil shale, that consists of a mixture of hydrocarbon molecules containing between twenty and forty carbon atoms.

label: oil shale
definition: An organic-rich fine-grained sedimentary rock containing kerogen from which liquid hydrocarbons called shale oil can be produced.

label: peat drainage
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water| some peat soil|drainage process
definition: A drainage process during which water is transported away from peat.

label: paint
definition: Any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film. It is most commonly used to protect, color, or provide texture to objects.

label: lead paint
definition: Paint that contains lead.

label: transportation
definition: A planned process that is the movement of people, animals and goods from one location to another.

label: wood ash
definition: the residue powder that is derived from the combustion of wood.

label: coal ash
definition: Ash that is produced from the burning of coal.

label: fly ash
definition: A very fine, powdery material composed mostly of silica made from the burning of finely ground coal in a boiler.

label: bottom ash
definition: a coarse, angular ash particle that is too large to be carried up into the smoke stacks so it forms in the bottom of the coal furnace.

label: boiler slag
definition: molten bottom ash from slag tap and cyclone type furnaces that turns into pellets that have a smooth glassy appearance after it is cooled with water.

label: flue gas desulfurization material
definition: a material leftover from the process of reducing sulfur dioxide emissions from a coal-fired boiler that can be a wet sludge consisting of calcium sulfite or calcium sulfate or a dry powered material that is a mixture of sulfites and sulfates.

label: constructed monument
definition: A human construction which serves as a memorial.

label: nuclear reactor
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (anthropogenic generation of energy and ( some nuclear energy))|human construction
definition: A human construction which is used to initiate and control a fission nuclear chain reaction or nuclear fusion reactions.

label: thermal nuclear reactor
definition: A nuclear reactor which uses a neutron moderator to slow neutrons until they approach the average kinetic energy of the surrounding particles.

label: fast neutron reactor
definition: A nuclear reactor in which the fission chain reaction is sustained by fast neutrons.

label: research nuclear reactor
definition: A nuclear reactor which serves primarily as a neutron source for purposes other than power.

label: nuclear power reactor
definition: A nuclear reactor which is used as a source of power.

label: mangrove biome soil
definition: Soil which is located in a mangrove biome.

label: desert spring
definition: A spring that is located in the desert.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is unable to resist shear forces and continuously deforms when subject to them.

label: refinery
definition: A human construction which is used to process materials into forms that have increased value or utility in downstream processes.

label: petroleum oil refinery
definition: A refinery which is capable of processing petroleum oil.

label: sugar refinery
definition: A refinery which is capable of processing raw sugar. Raw sugar is processed from cane or beets into white refined sugar.

label: natural gas processing plant
definition: A refinery which is capable of processing natural gas. Natural-gas processing encompasses a range of industrial processes designed to purify raw natural gas by removing impurities, contaminants and higher molecular mass hydrocarbons to produce what is known as pipeline quality dry natural gas

label: subterranean lake
definition: A lake underneath the surface of the Earth.

label: chemical engineering process
definition: A planned process which has the intention of producing, consuming, or transforming materials via the execution of chemical reactions.

label: refinement process
definition: A planned material transformation process which takes as input a material and removes impurities.

label: Haber-Bosch process
definition: A chemical engineering process that produces ammonia en masse via artificial nitrogen fixation.

label: hydrogen production process
definition: A chemical engineering process which generates hydrogen gas.

label: uranium deposit
definition: A mineral deposit that contains uranium ore.

label: natural nuclear fission reactor
definition: A uranium deposit where self-sustaining nuclear chain reactions have occurred.

label: mangrove biome sediment
definition: Sediment that is part of a mangrove biome.

label: marine salt marsh sediment
definition: Sediment that is part of a salt marsh.

label: animal construction
SYNONYMS: Non-human animal assembled structure|Non-human animal construction
definition: A construction that is assembled by a non-human animal

label: solid waste material
definition: Solid material that has a waste role.

label: organic dairy farm
definition: A dairy farm which is managed using practices certified to be organic by a competent authority.

label: municipal landfill
definition: A landfill that receives household waste.

label: biological nutrient removal during wastewater treatment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some wastewater treatment process|waste recycling process
definition: A recycling process that uses microbes for the uptake of nitrogen and phosphorus during wastewater treatment.

label: bee hive
definition: An animal habitation that is assembled by colonies of organisms in the clade Anthophila (bees). Each nest is composed of multiple honeycombs, constructed using beeswax for the purposes of rearing young and storing honey and pollen.

label: hymenopteran habitation
definition: An animal habitation assembled by organisms within the clade Hymenoptera. Examples include termite nests, beehives, and ant nests. Typically constructed to serve as habitation for a whole colony ruled by a queen.

label: termite mound
definition: A termite nest that is built above ground, and is made of soil, saliva, and feces, formed as a large mound.

label: termite subterranean nest
definition: A termite nest that is underground, often connected to food sources through a network of tunnels.

label: termite arboreal nest
definition: A termite nest that is built above ground in trees or on structures, often resembling large lumps attached to branches.

label: crocodilian nest
definition: An animal habitation that is assembled by an organism in the order Crocodylia (alligators, crocodiles, caimans, and gharials). These habitations (nests), are typically built in freshwater or brackish environments. They can be mound nests, made from vegetation, mud, and organic material, or hole nests, excavated in sandy or muddy banks. These nests serve as sites for egg laying, incubation, and initial care of the young.

label: nest of crocodile
definition: An animal habitation that is constructed by organisms in the family Crocodylidae (crocodiles).

label: natural bee hive
definition: A bee hive that occurs naturally without human intervention, typically found in environments such as tree cavities, rock crevices, or underground burrows.

label: anthropogenic bee hive
definition: A bee hive that is built in a structure assembled by humans to house bee colonies, often for the purposes of honey production, pollination, or research.

label: anthropogenic bee hive structure
definition: A human construction that serves as a structure in which bees can build their hives.

label: beeswax
definition: A natural wax that is produced by a bee.

label: honeycomb
definition: A modular structure created by bees (Anthophila) from beeswax, consisting of a mass of hexagonal prismatic cells used to store honey, pollen, and house brood (eggs, larvae, and pupae).

label: nest of wasp
definition: An animal habitation that is assembled by a wasp. These may be in the ground, in wall cavities, or in sheltered areas.

label: beaver lodge
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (pond and ( some beaver dam))|animal habitation
definition: An animal habitation created by a beaver, constructed within or adjacent to the pond created by the beaver dam.

label: ant dump
definition: An animal construction created by leaf-cutter ants that is composed of various materials that result from the ants' activities and behaviors, including degraded plant material, microbial communities, organic material, dead ants and fungus.

label: spider web
definition: An animal structure that is assembled by a spider from silk, that serves as both habitation and a structure to trap prey.

label: hydrocarbon bioremediation
definition: A process of bioremediation that specifically targets the breakdown of hydrocarbon pollutants, using engineered or adapted microorganisms to convert these organic compounds into less harmful substances.

label: metal bioremediation
definition: A bioremediation technique involving the use of specially engineered organisms, often microbes, that can sequester, mobilize, or transform metal contaminants into non-toxic forms.

label: persistent organic pollutant bioremediation
definition: A specialized form of bioremediation focusing on the degradation or transformation of persistent organic pollutants (POPs), employing engineered organisms capable of breaking down compounds that are resistant to environmental degradation.

label: terephthalate remediation
definition: A bioremediation process directed at the degradation of terephthalate compounds, utilizing genetically modified or specially adapted microorganisms to metabolize these synthetic polymers.

label: tetrachloroethylene or tetrachloroethylene derivative remediation
definition: A form of bioremediation that targets tetrachloroethylene and its derivatives, employing organisms that have been engineered to detoxify these chlorinated organic solvents.

label: thiocyanate remediation
definition: A bioremediation process specifically designed for the breakdown of thiocyanates, using modified organisms to convert thiocyanate into less harmful substances through biological pathways.

label: biotransformation process
definition: A planned process involving the deliberate use of biological agents, such as microbes or enzymes, to chemically modify substances in a controlled setting. This process is typically utilized to enhance the value or reduce the environmental impact of various materials.

label: biotransformation of coal
definition: A biotransformation process that targets coal, using engineered biological organisms to alter its chemical composition or properties, potentially enhancing its energy efficiency or reducing its environmental footprint.

label: microbial enhanced oil recovery
definition: A biotransformation that uses microorganisms to increase the extraction efficiency of oil from reservoirs. This process may involve the alteration of oil viscosity, the modification of reservoir properties, or the production of biosurfactants.

label: microbial solubization of coal
definition: A biotransformation that uses microbes to convert solid coal into a more soluble form, enhancing its utility for energy production or further chemical processing.

label: biotransformation of biomass into mixed alcohols
definition: A biotransformation process that produces mixed alcohols from from biomass via fermentation.

label: adit
definition: A horizontal or nearly horizontal passage to an underground mine.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: desertification
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (desert area or desert biome)| some (not (desert area or desert biome))|land degradation
definition: A type of land degradation in which terrestrial ecosystem becomes increasingly dry, typically losing its bodies of water as well as vegetation and wildlife.

label: flooding
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (material accumulation process and ( some liquid water))| some (material transport process and ( some liquid water))| some planetary landmass| some water body|material transport process
definition: A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from the overflow of inland and/or tidal waters, and/or the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source. A great flow along a watercourse or a flow causing inundation of lands not normally covered by water.

label: atmospheric process
definition: A process which occurs within an atmosphere.

label: greenhouse effect
definition: A process by which thermal radiation from a planetary surface is absorbed by atmospheric greenhouse gases, and is re-radiated in all directions. Since part of this re-radiation is back towards the surface and the lower atmosphere, it results in an elevation of the average surface temperature above what it would be in the absence of the gases.

label: land degradation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some land consumption process| some planetary landmass| some terrestrial biome|ecosystem process
definition: A process which diminishes the functioning of an ecosystem located on land.

label: ecosystem-wide photosynthesis
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some GO:0015979|ENVO:01001795|RO:0002233 some (CHEBI:16526 and (ENVO:00002006 and (RO:0000087 some CHEBI:15022)))|RO:0002234 some (CHEBI:15379 and CHEBI:16646)
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some ( and (liquid water and ( some )))| some ( and )|ecosystem process
definition: A process which consists of all photosynthesis processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: ecosystem-wide respiration
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some GO:0045333|ENVO:02500000|RO:0002233 some (CHEBI:24431 and (RO:0000087 some CHEBI:17654))|RO:0002233 some (CHEBI:24431 and (RO:0000087 some CHEBI:33284))|RO:0002234 some CHEBI:15422
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some ( and ( some ))| some ( and ( some ))|environmental system process
definition: A process which consists of all respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: biogeochemical cycling
definition: A biogeochemical process during which one or more chemical compounds are sequentially converted into a series of related compounds in a regularly repeating, periodic fashion.

label: carbon cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has carbon-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: afforestation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some (forest biome or forest)| some (not (forest biome or forest))|planned revegetation
definition: Establishment of a new forest by seeding or planting of nonforested land.

label: deforestation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (forested area or forest biome)| some (not (forested area or forest biome))|ecosystem process
definition: An ecosystem process during which the flora and fauna belonging to a forest are removed or destroyed.

label: reforestation
definition: The planting of trees in areas in where forests have previously been cleared.

label: algal bloom process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some algal bloom| some aquatic environment|ecosystem process
definition: A process during which the populations in a community of algae in a marine or freshwater ecosystem undergo rapid growth, resulting in high concentrations of algal cells that occur only periodically and briefly in that ecosystem, relative to their concentrations through the majority of the planetary orbital period.

label: algal bloom collapse
definition: A process during which the rapid growth of algal populations that result in an algal bloom ceases, and cell densities begin to fall due to death, predation, and transport.

label: algal production
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some algal bloom process|ecosystem process
definition: A process during which the algal cells constituting an algal bloom produce biomass from abiotic components during photosynthesis.

label: accumulation of toxins from algal bloom process
degradation of toxins from algal bloom process
anthropogenic modulatory intervention process
definition: A process during which humans apply technology to alter the magnitude, duration, rate, or impact of an environmental process.

label: anthropogenic environmental process
definition: An environmental process which is driven by the action of humans.

label: planetary erosion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some planetary crust|erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one part of a planet's crust, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: bedrock dissolution
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some ))| some bedrock|planetary erosion
definition: An erosional process in which bedrock is converted from its solid form into a solute by the action of some solvent.

label: biogeochemical process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some natural environment|environmental system process
definition: A process during which chemicals that are involved in natural ecosystem processes are transported or transformed, and which impact the activity of biological entities

label: hydrological process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( or water vapour or water ice)|environmental system process
definition: An environmental process which has water - in any of its states - as a participant.

label: planned revegetation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some vegetated area|active ecosystem management process
definition: A planned process during which human agents establish plant communities in ecosystems which have previously been, partially or wholly, stripped of existing plant communities.

label: evapotranspiration
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (hydrological evaporation and transpiration)|material transport process
definition: Evapotranspiration is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth's land and ocean surface to the atmosphere.

label: evaporation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (surface layer and ( some (environmental material and ( some ))))|vapourisation
definition: Evaporation is a form of vaporisation which occurs when a portion of the surface layer of a liquid in contact with a gaseous material, which is not saturated with the evaporating substance, vaporises.

label: transpiration
definition: Transpiration is the process of water movement through a plant and its evaporation from aerial parts of that plant, such as from leaves but also from stems and flowers.

label: environmental pollution
subClassOf [ID]: ENVO:02500000|RO:0002234 some (ENVO:00010483 and (ENVO:02000200 some (CHEBI:24431 and (RO:0000087 some CHEBI:78298))))
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and (has increased levels of some ( and ( some ))))|environmental system process
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: air pollution
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental system and ( some air))| some (environmental system and ( some contaminated air))
definition: A pollution process during which particulates or other contaminants are released into a portion of air.

label: soil pollution
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental system and ( some contaminated soil))| some (environmental system and ( some soil))| some contaminated soil
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into soil.

label: water pollution
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental system and ( some contaminated water))| some (environmental system and ( some liquid water))
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into water.

label: plastic pollution
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and (has increased levels of some (synthetic plastic and ( some ))))|environmental pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: environmental monitoring
subClassOf [ID]: OBI:0000011|RO:0000057 some (ENVO:00010483 or ENVO:01000254 or ENVO:01000813)|RO:0002608 some NCBITaxon:9606
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some (environmental material or environmental system or astronomical body part)|
definition: An process in which environmental parameters and variables are continually assayed.

label: pollution control
definition: A planned process during which the amount of pollutants released into an environmental system is regulated.

label: pollution monitoring
definition: A monitoring process that assays the level of environmental pollutants to determine the presence of effect of environmental pollution.

label: urban pollution
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (urban biome and ( some (environmental material and (has increased levels of some ( and ( some ))))))| some urban biome|environmental pollution
definition: A pollution process that results in increased levels of pollutants in an urban environment.

label: neve
definition: Partially compacted granular snow, which has undergone several cycles of melting and refreezing while being compacted, usually found on the atmosphere-exposed surface of a glacier.

label: firn
definition: Granular snow which contains a proportion of fused granules formed through melting and re-thawing while being compacted by the weight of overlying material and which contains interconnected gaseous pores.

label: nivation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (neve or firn)| some compaction process| some powdery snow| some snowfall|material transformation process
definition: A material transformation process during which recently precipitated, powdery snow transitions into firn or nv through compaction and/or through cycles of freezing and thawing.

label: glacial ice
definition: Any water ice that is part of a glacier.

label: erosionally enriched glacial ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial erosion process| some glacier|erosionally enriched ice
definition: Glacial ice which contains material liberated during a glacial erosion process.

label: glacial erosion process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some planetary landmass|planetary erosion
definition: An erosion process during which the movement of a glacier across a terrestrial surface causes the removal of material from that surface.

label: blue ice
definition: Water ice containing little to no air bubbles resulting in a reduction of internal light scattering and, given sufficient volume, a blue appearance.

label: compaction process
definition: A physical process during which atoms, molecules, or other consituents of a material entity are forced closer together.

label: material accumulation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some ))| some (material transport process or material transformation process)|environmental system process
definition: A process during which the mass of one or more materials, present within a given site, increases.

label: material transport process
definition: A process during which material is displaced from its original location and transported either to a new location or back to the original location.

label: ice gain
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some water ice|ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of an existing ice mass increases.

label: glacial transport process
definition: A material transport process during which the snow and ice constituting a glacier, and anything contained within it, is transported down a slope by gravitation.

label: cirque glacier
definition: A small glacier contained within a cirque basin.

label: geographic basin
definition: A depression which is part of a planetary crust, is of geographic scale, and is partially or completely enclosed.

label: material decumulation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some ))| some (material transport process or material transformation process)|environmental system process
definition: A process during which a mass composed of one or more environmental materials, present within a given site, decreases.

label: glacial ice loss
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice| some glacier|ice loss process
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier decreases.

label: englacial stream
subClassOf [LABEL]: some englacial| some meltwater|partially_surrounded_by some (ice sheet or glacier)|stream
definition: A stream which is primarily composed of meltwater and which flows within a glacier or ice sheet.

label: aeolian transport process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric wind| some environmental material|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which one or more environmental materials are transported by the action of wind.

label: soot
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of carbon particles formed through the incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.

label: erosionally enriched ice
definition: Water ice which contains material liberated during an erosion process.

label: powdery snow
definition: Uncompacted snow containing trapped atmospheric gases.

label: glacial ice gain
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (liquid water or snow or ice or neve or firn)| some glacial ice| some glacier|ice gain
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier increases.

label: glacial ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass.

label: iceberg calving process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (marine iceberg and (derives from part of some glacier))|glacial ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass as an iceberg.

label: calving of ice from an iceberg
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ice mass and (derives from part of some iceberg))| some marine iceberg|ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of an iceberg breaks away from the main mass.

label: marine sediment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some sedimentation in a water body|sediment
definition: Sediment which has been transported through the marine water column, settling on the seafloor.

label: shallow marine sediment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (sedimentation in a water body and ( some neritic pelagic zone biome))| some continental shelf|marine sediment
definition: Marine sediment soured from either terrestrial systems, marine organisms, seawater and or cosmogeneous sources, which is transported through the marine water column, and accumulates within shallow regions of the oceanic basin close to continents, such as the continental shelf, or continental slope.

label: supraglacial lake
definition: A water body which is located in a depression within the surface of a glacier.

label: sedimentation in a water body
subClassOf [LABEL]: some material transport process| some particulate environmental material| some precipitation process| some water body|material accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which solid particles are pulled through a water body by gravitation or centrifugal force and which ends when they settle on a solid surface.

label: glacial ice ablation zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice ablation process| some glacier|ice ablation zone
SYNONYMS: area of glacial ablation|glacial ablation area|glacial ice ablation area
definition: An ablation zone which is part of a glacier.

label: cryoconite deposit
subClassOf [LABEL]: some aeolian transport process| some dust| some rock| some soot|particulate environmental material
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of dust, rock, and soot, as well as the microbial communities associated with these materials, deposited on an ice mass by an aeolian process.

label: cryoconite hole
definition: A vertical thaw hole within an ice mass, formed as a result of ice melt associated with local temperature increases, due to increased absorption of solar radiation by cryoconite deposits.

label: melt pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some icemelt| some meltwater|water body
definition: A water body which forms as a result of localised melting taking place on the surface of a glacier or a mass of sea ice and which is contained in the cavity formed by such melting.

label: brine channel
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brine| some brine channel formation process| some water ice|channel
definition: A channel through which brine flows.

label: brine channel formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brine| some brine channel| some brine rejection from seawater| some water ice|material accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which brine droplets, trapped between ice crystals formed during seawater freezing, form brine channels.

label: material transformation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some environmental material|environmental system process
definition: A process during which a portion of some environmental material is converted into a different material or a collection of materials.

label: sea ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ocean water| some sea ice|water ice formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which seawater freezes into sea ice.

label: brine rejection from seawater
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brine| some ocean water| some sea ice formation process|material transformation process
definition: A material transformation process during which brine is formed due to the expulsion of salt during frazil formation or a seawater freezing process.

label: frazil ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some frazil|new ice|partially_surrounded_by some liquid water
definition: New ice which is composed frazil which has congealed into a thin sheet.

label: frazil ice formation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some frazil ice| some liquid water|new ice formation process
definition: A new ice formation process during which small, needle-like crystals consisting of nearly pure fresh water, form due to the freezing of open, turbulent, supercooled water.

label: thaw hole
definition: A channel which traverses an ice mass floating on a water body and bridges the atmosphere to the underlying water through its internal cavity.

label: atmosphere-exposed melt pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some melting| some meltwater| some troposphere|melt pond
definition: A melt pond which has a surface exposed to the atmosphere.

label: ice-encased melt pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some melting| some meltwater|melt pond|surrounded by some water ice
definition: A melt pond which is completely encased in ice and thus not directly exposed to the atmosphere or underlying water.

label: intraglacial lake
definition: A lake which is comprised of meltwater located underneath or within a glacier.

label: depositional process
definition: A process during which material entities are added to a landform or to a feature upon the landform.

label: desublimation of water vapour into ice
definition: A desublimation process during which water vapour is frozen into water ice.

label: new ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (frazil ice or shuga or slush ice)| some liquid water|water ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which water is frozen into a form of new ice such as frazil, grease ice, slush, or shuga.

label: obsolete sea ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which seawater is frozen into a sea ice.

label: nilas formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some new ice| some nilas|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which new ice crystals freeze together, forming nilas, a thin, elastic, continuous, ice sheet of a transparent gray color.

label: young ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean water and nilas)| some young ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which water freezes to the bottom of an existing nilas ice floe creating a thicker ice floe known as young ice.

label: first year ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean water and young ice)| some first year ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto young ice during the cold season, forming first year ice.

label: second year ice formation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean water and first year ice)| some second year ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto first year ice during the cold season, forming second year sea ice.

label: multiyear ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes into second year ice during the cold season, forming multiyear ice.

label: new ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some new ice formation process| some water body|water ice
definition: Water ice which is formed from freezing water and is suspended in a water body.

label: ice floe
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some water body| some water ice|ice mass
definition: An ice mass which forms a cohesive and contiguous sheet of water ice, floating upon the surface of a water body.

label: sea ice floe
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean or sea)| some sea ice formation process| some water ice|ice floe
definition: An ice floe which is formed from frozen sea water, and floats upon the surface of a marine water body.

label: pancake ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some (ocean or sea)| some sea ice formation process| some water ice|sea ice floe
definition: A sea ice floe which has a rounded or circular shape and raised rims.

label: nilas
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some (ocean or sea)| some nilas formation process| some water ice|sea ice floe
definition: A sea ice floe which is thin, elastic, continuous, and of a transparent gray color, which results from the freezing of new ice.

label: young ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some water ice| some young ice formation process|sea ice floe
definition: A sea ice floe which is inflexible and thicker than nilas.

label: first year ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some first year ice formation process| some young ice|sea ice
definition: Sea ice which has formed over a single freezing season.

label: second year ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some second year ice formation|sea ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than first year ice, and has survived a seasonal melting process.

label: multiyear ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some multiyear ice formation process|sea ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than second year ice, and has survived more than two seasonal melting process.

label: grease ice layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some water body|water ice layer
definition: A layer which consists of a thin aggregate of frazil ice crystals, which float upon the surface of a water body.

label: shuga
definition: New ice, which is spongy, lumpy and opaque, and forms from water which freezes in an agitated water body.

label: slush ice
definition: A slurry of frazil, snow, and liquid water.

label: slush ice layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some slush ice| some water body|water ice layer
definition: A layer which consists of slush ice.

label: slush formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (liquid water and snow and frazil ice)| some slush ice|new ice formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which slush ice is formed.

label: shuga formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water| some shuga|new ice formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which shuga is formed.

label: thermokarst lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice-bearing permafrost thawing process| some meltwater| some thermokarst| some thermokarst depression|freshwater lake
definition: A freshwater lake which fills a depression formed by the erosion of thermokarst caused by permafrost thaw.

label: methane-releasing thermokarst lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some atmosphere| some methane gas emission process|thermokarst lake
definition: A thermokarst lake through which methane gas released from thawing permafrost, or other methane stores, rises and escapes to the atmosphere.

label: thermokarst depression
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice-bearing permafrost thawing process| some thermokarst|geographic basin
definition: A geographic basin which is formed due to the erosion of thermokarst by meltwater released from thawing permafrost.

label: thermokarst
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice-bearing permafrost thawing process| some thermokarst depression|planetary landmass
definition: An irregular land surface which consists of marshy hollows, hummocks, thermokarst depressions and thermokarst lakes formed from the erosion of ice-rich thawing permafrost areas.

label: ice-bearing permafrost thawing process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (water ice and ( some permafrost))| some hydrological melting process| some meltwater| some methane gas emission process|permafrost thawing process
definition: A permafrost thawing process during which water-based ice or snow present in permafrost is converted into meltwater.

label: methane-laden permafrost
definition: Permafrost which contains pockets of trapped methane gas.

label: permafrost crater derived from a methane explosion
definition: A crater which is found in permafrost and formed as a result of an explosion fuelled by methane formerly contained in that permafrost.

label: explosion process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some ))| some (environmental material and ( some ))| some gaseous environmental material|combustion process
definition: A process during which a material entity undergoes a rapid increase in volume, releasing gasses and various forms of energy, often including thermal, light and sound energy.

label: permafrost methane explosion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some (gaseous environmental material and ( some ))| some permafrost| some permafrost|explosion process
definition: An explosion during which methane-rich gas trapped in permafrost combusts.

label: gas emission process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (gaseous environmental material and ( some atmosphere))| some (gaseous environmental material and (not ( some atmosphere)))|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material is transported into the atmosphere.

label: hydrocarbon gas emission process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some greenhouse effect| some hydrocarbon gas|gas emission process
definition: A gas emission process during which a portion of hydrocarbon gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: methane gas emission process
definition: A hydrocarbon gas emission process during which a portion of methane gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: season generating process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some planet| some season| some star|environmental system process
definition: A process during which the intesity of stellar radiation received by a planet's surface varies in a cyclical regime due to the planet's orbital motion around the barycentre of a planetary system and/or the tilt of its rotational axis relative to its orbital plane.

label: season
definition: A one-dimensional temporal region which is delimited by the occurrence of processes which serve as its delimiters.

label: warm season
definition: A season during which the average temperature of a planetary part exceeds that of all other seasons it endures during a season generating process.

label: cold season
definition: A season during which the average temperature of a planetary part is below that of all other seasons it endures during a season generating process.

label: seasonal melting process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material entity melts during a warm season.

label: solid-phase sintering
definition: A compaction process during which a material entity subjected to heat and/or pressure is compacted into a solid mass without undergoing melting.

label: glacial sintering
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))| some glacial ice| some snow|solid-phase sintering
definition: A sintering process during which snow is compacted into glacial ice.

label: aeolian transport of snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some powdery snow|aeolian transport process
definition: An aeolian transport process during which powdery snow is displaced and moved.

label: snow drift formation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some aeolian transport of snow| some powdery snow|snow accumulation process
definition: An accumulation process during which a powdery snow carried on the wind settles on a solid surface, forming a mound.

label: slab avalanche
definition: A mass wasting process during which slab snow rapidly moves down a sloping surface.

label: powdery snow avalanche
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some powdery snow))|avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which powdery snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: wet snow avalanche
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and (liquid water and ( some snow)))|avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which a suspension of water and snow flows down a sloping surface.

label: slab snow
definition: Snow which is cohesive, hard and overlies weaker snow.

label: cryoform
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is primarily composed of a continuous mass of snow and/or ice.

label: snow mass
definition: A mass of snow.

label: snow drift
subClassOf [LABEL]: some powdery snow| some snow drift formation|snow mass
definition: An accumulation of powdery snow which was transported and deposited via a snow drifting process.

label: snow patch
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (snow and firn)| some cold season| some planetary landmass|snow mass
definition: An accumulation of snow and firn which rests upon land.

label: seasonal snow patch
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (snow and firn)| some cold season| some planetary landmass| some seasonal melting process|snow patch
definition: A snow patch which forms during a cold season and melts away during the succeeding warm season.

label: perennial snow patch
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (snow and firn)| some cold season| some planetary landmass| some seasonal melting process|snow patch
definition: A snow patch which persists through at least one seasonal cycle.

label: snowpack
subClassOf [LABEL]: some compaction process| some snow|snow mass
definition: A snow mass which is large enough, and persists long enough, to undergo compaction under its own weight, leading to layer-like structural differentiation.

label: channel
definition: A structure which traverses a mass of one or more environmental materials, and encloses a roughly tubular site.

label: atmosphere and water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which and is exposed to the atmosphere and to a lesser degree water underlying the ice mass which contains it.

label: water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which is formed close to that part of an ice mass which is in contact with some underlying water body, and which has channels connecting it to that water body.

label: subglacial lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some planetary landmass|ice-covered lake
definition: A lake which is situated beneath a glacier.

label: erosion through nivation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some nivation|(soil and ( some soil erosion)) or ( some rock)|planetary erosion
definition: An erosion process during which rock or soil is removed or degraded due to alternative thawing and freezing of meltwater beneath and at the margins of snowbanks.

label: planned burn
definition: A fire which is planned and executed deliberately under human supervision.

label: concentration of nitrate and nitrite in liquid water
SYNONYMS: liquid water nitrate and nitrite concentration
definition: The concentration of nitrate and nitrite when measured in liquid water.

label: acid rainfall
definition: A water-based rainfall process during which water droplets with increased acidity fall towards a planetary surface.

label: acidic water-based rain
definition: Water-based rain which has increased acidity.

label: monsoon season
definition: A season during which changes in atmospheric circulation associated with the asymmetric heating of land and sea cause moisture to be brought inland by monsoon winds, leading to increased rainfall as moisture-laden air rises  and cools over land.

label: monsoon wind
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (ocean or sea)| some monsoon season| some planetary landmass|atmospheric wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which air masses over an ocean flow towards a land mass, driven by disequilibria between land and ocean surface temperatures.

label: grass fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a grassland, combusting biomass stored in grasses as its primary fuel.

label: firebreak
definition: A woodland clearing which is large enough to starve land fires of fuel, impeding their progress through wooded areas.

label: agricultural potting mixture
definition: An agricultural environmental material which 1) is composed of a mixture of materials such as peat, composted bark, sand, perlite, or compost, and 2) serves as a medium in which to grow plants.

label: WMO blizzard
definition: A blizzard which 1) lasts at least 3 hours, 2) combines below freezing temperatures and very strong wind, laden with blowing snow.

label: NSIDC blizzard
definition: A blizzard which has 1) winds of 35 miles per hour (approximately 56 kilometers per hour), 2) lasts for a period of at least three hours, and 3) occurs in extremely cold temperatures.

label: winter blizzard
definition: A blizzard which occurs in winter.

label: freezing fog
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (water ice formation process and ( some (glaze ice layer or rime)))|fog
definition: A fog the droplets of which freeze upon contact with exposed objects, forming a coating of rime or glaze.

label: particle of snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some snow))| some ( and )| some freezing of water into water ice| some water ice|( some snow) or (derives from part of some snow)|particle
SYNONYMS: grain of snow|granular snow|granule of snow|snow grain|snow granule|snow particle
definition: A particle which is 1) primarily compposed of water ice, 2) on the order of 1 milimeter or less, 3) has a white and opaque appearance, and 4) is formed as a result of water droplets freezing during precipitation.

label: ice fog
SYNONYMS: air hoar|frost flakes|frost fog|frozen fog|ice-crystal fog|pogonip|rime fog
definition: Fog which is composed of particles of ice.

label: tundra climate
definition: A climate which 1) has a mean temperature for the warmest month of less than 10C (50F), but higher than 0C (32F), 2) is not conducive to a permanent surficial cover of snow or ice, and 3) supports a tundra ecosystem.

label: snow layer
definition: A cryospheric layer which is primarily composed of snow.

label: snow water equivalent
definition: A depth which inheres in a layer of liquid water derived from the complete melting a mass of snow contained in an area.

label: cryosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental material and ( some ))|astronomical body part
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed primarily of environmental materials in their frozen form.

label: planetary cryosphere
definition: A cryosphere which is part of a planet.

label: snow-covered land
SYNONYMS: area of snow cover|land covered by snow|snow covered land
definition: Land which is covered or partially covered by snow.

label: water cooling
definition: A material transport process during which liquid water is circulated in the vicinity of a heat source in order to absorb thermal energy and transport it away form that source.

label: thickness of snow
definition: The thickness of some snow.

label: area of alpine tundra
definition: An area of tundra which is present in a region subject to alpine conditions.

label: area of polar tundra
definition: An area of tundra which is present in a region subject to polar conditions.

label: snow cover
definition: An area density which inheres in snow distributed over an area of a landmass or other substrate.

label: heavy snowfall
definition: Snowfall which has an increased rate.

label: ice pellet
definition: An ice mass which is 1) transparent or translucent, 2) rounded, spherically, or cylindrically shaped, and 3) less than 5 milimetres in diameter.

label: lake-effect snowfall
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (air mass and ( some ))| some (air mass and ( some ))| some lake| some material warming process|snowfall
definition: Snowfall which 1) is localized, 2) is convective, and 3) occurs as a result of a cold, dry air mass absorbing heat and moisture as it flows over a lake with warmer waters.

label: lake-effect snow storm
definition: A snowstorm during which intense lake-effect snowfall occurs.

label: lambing storm
definition: A snowfall which occurs during springtime and is of low intensity.

label: falling sleet
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (freezing of water into water ice and thawing process)| some sleet pellet| some water droplet| some water ice crystal|
definition: An object aggregate which is primarily composed of particles of water in liquid, frozen, or partially frozen states.

label: freezing rain
definition: Water-based rain which is composed of supercooled water droplets, which freeze on contact with surfaces.

label: hail
definition: Precipitation which is composed primarily of hail stones.

label: hail stone
definition: An ice mass which 1) occurs in a ball-shape or irregular lump, 2) has a minimum diameter of 5 millimeters (or 0.2 inches), and 3) is formed within convective clouds.

label: falling snow
definition: An object aggregate which is composed primarily of snow falling through an atmosphere.

label: precipitation of sleet
definition: A hydrological precipitation process during which water falls in both liquid and frozen form.

label: sleet pellet
definition: An ice mass which is primarily composed of frozen or mostly frozen raindrops or refrozen partially melted snowflakes.

label: area of ice cover
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice surface layer|fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: An environmental zone which is covered or partially covered by ice.

label: depth of water ice
definition: The depth of some water ice.

label: playground
definition: A park which has been designed for the recreation of children.

label: public park
definition: A park which is owned by a governmental or state entity and which is accessible by its citizenry (i.e. the public).

label: public sports field
definition: A sports facility which has been constructed for sports that require large outdoor spaces and is owned by a governmental or state entity and which is accessible by its citizenry (i.e. the public).

label: bike path
definition: A constructed pavement which is intended for bicycle traffic

label: anthropogenic litter
definition: A material entity which has been discarded outside waste management systems by humans or their technologies.

label: food desert
definition: An anthropogenic environment in which populations of humans have limited acess to affordable and nutritious food.

label: noisy environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some sound wave energy))|environmental system determined by a quality
definition: An environment in which entities are exposed to either excessive or constant sound.

label: safe environment for human presence
definition: An environment in which humans have a low likelihood of being harmed or killed.

label: attractive environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: environmental system determined by a quality
definition: An environment which includes components which are deemed to be aesthetically pleasing by a population of humans.

label: shady environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: environmental system determined by a quality
definition: An environmental system which is shielded from direct stellar irradiation by material entities.

label: violent environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: environmental system determined by a quality
definition: An environment in which humans are exposed to regularly occurring physical or emotional violence.

label: ultrasound radiation
definition: An acoustic radiation process during which waves that transmit sound energy at frequencies above 20 kHz are emitted by a source.

label: mid-infrared radiation
definition: An infrared radiation during which waves with frequencies between 30 THz and 120 THz and with wavelengths between 10 micrometers and 2.5 micrometers are emitted by a source.

label: near-infrared radiation
definition: An infrared radiation during which waves with frequencies between 120 THz and 400 THz and with wavelengths between 2.5 micrometers and 750 nanometers are emitted by a source.

label: far-infrared radiation
definition: An infrared radiation which consists of waves with frequencies between 300 GHz and 30 THz and with wavelengths between 1 mm and 10 micrometers are emitted by a source.

label: electroplating fume
definition: A fume containing volatile organic compounds produced through the process of electroplating

label: soldering fumes
definition: A fume containing solid particles of solder, produced through the process of melting solder to join multiple metals together.

label: solder
definition: A metallic material which is composed of two or more metals and used to create a permanent bond between metal workpieces.

label: lead solder
definition: A solder which includes lead.

label: non-lead solder
definition: A solder which is composed without lead.

label: gasoline vapor
definition: A fume produced by liquid gasoline, containing aerosolized components of the gasoline.

label: noise
definition: An energy transfer process that moves vibrations through a medium, such as air or water, that is received and perceived by an organism and considered unpleasant, loud, or disruptive.

label: road traffic noise
definition: A noise produced by road traffic and automobiles.

label: aircraft noise
definition: A noise produced by aircrafts.

label: secondhand smoke
definition: A smoke which is inhaled involuntarily from a tobacco product smoked by another individual.

label: pneumatic drill
definition: A hand tool that uses air-power to drill holes or destroy hard surfaces like rock, concrete, or asphalt

label: ferry
definition: A merchant vessel which is used to carry passengers, vehicles, or cargo across a body of water.

label: outdoor environment
definition: An environmental system which is not sheltered.

label: polytunnel
definition: An industrial building made from steel and covered in polyethylene used for plant cultivation.

label: ambulance
definition: A motor vehicle which is equipped with medical equipment and can be used to transport humans to treatment facilities.

definition: A boat which provides short-term residential and entertainment facilities to passengers.

label: merchant vessel
definition: A transport boat which can be hired.

label: train
definition: A vehicle which locomotes using rails and consists of a series of connected compartments used to transport passengers or cargo.

label: passenger train
definition: A train which is capable of and used for passenger transport.

label: subway train
definition: A passenger train which runs along an undergroud rail system.

label: constructed transport system
definition: A system which has components that have been constructed to allow the movement of people or goods.

label: public transit system
subClassOf [LABEL]: some public infrastructure| some usage of an environment for community and social services|constructed transport system
definition: A constructed transport system which is owned by a government or other form of public representation.

label: public bus
definition: A bus which is part of public infrastructure.

label: public ferry
definition: A ferry which is owned by a government or other form of public representation.

label: public train
definition: A train which is owned by a government or other form of public representation.

label: public subway train

SYNONYMS: MRT|heavy rail|light rail|mass rapid transit|medium-capacity rail|metro
definition: A public transit system which is owned by a government or other form of public representation.

definition: A research station in which food production and/or agribusinness research is performed.

SYNONYMS: for-profit correctional center|for-profit correctional centre|for-profit correctional facility|for-profit detention center|for-profit detention centre|for-profit jail|for-profit lock-up|for-profit penitentiary|for-profit prison|for-profit remand center|for-profit remand centre|private correctional center|private correctional centre|private correctional facility|private detention center|private jail|private lock-up|private penitentiary|private remand center|private remand centre

definition: A poll which is attached to the head, foot, or side of a bed frame.

definition: A manufactured product consisting of a panel on which control or monitoring instruments are set.

definition: A manufactured product consisting of a handle used to open or close a door.

label: skerry

SYNONYMS: wind park|wind power plant|wind power station
definition: A power plant which is a group of wind turbines in the same location used to produce electricity.

label: desert island
definition: An island that is not permanently populated by humans.

label: big-box store

label: drawbridge
definition: A bridge which is hinged and can be raised.

label: footbridge

label: humpback bridge
definition: A bridge which arches in the center, and has a span which is higher than the ramps on either side, forming a hump-like arrangement.

label: overpass
definition: A bridge which is used for transportaiton, and which crosses over another road or railway.

label: suspension bridge

definition: A bridge which is movable and has a vertical locating pin as its primary structural support, and a support ring about which it can pivot horizontally.

label: vacuum cleaner

label: chicken manure
definition: Poultry manure made of chicken feces.

label: water tank
definition: A container for storing water.

definition: An anthropogenic geographic feature consisting of a receptacle intended to provide drinking water to animals.

label: sheet of paper
definition: A paper product which is a thin sheet material made of processed cellulose fibres.

definition: An agricultural building used for crop storage or animal husbandry.

label: chicken house

label: litter

definition: A manufactured product consisting of a  shallow platform designed for the carrying of items.

label: squeegee

label: public toilet
definition: An indoor toilet that is available for public use.

definition: A device that moves fluids (liquids or gases), or sometimes slurries, by mechanical action.

label: packaging machine
definition: A device used in packaging operations.

label: mosque

label: bunkhouse
definition: A residential building containing bunks or beds which are often not separated by walls.

label: corn exchange
definition: A commercial building where merchants trade grains.
