label: skyscraper
definition: A building which historically has at least 10 floors.

label: tenement
definition: A residential building shared by multiple dwellings, typically with flats or apartments on each floor and with shared entrance stairway access.

label: mausoleum
definition: A public building constructed as a external, free-standing monument enclosing the interment space or burial chamber of a deceased person or people.

label: bowling alley
definition: A sports facility where bowling is played.

label: hangar

label: conveyor belt

label: dryer
definition: A device designed to remove water or humidity.

label: clothes dryer
definition: A dryer that is used to remove moisture from textiles.

label: calf shed
definition: A cow shed for baby cows/bulls.

label: livestock house
definition: An animal house used for housing livestock.

label: facility
definition: A material entity which has been designed to promote the accomplishment of one or more defined tasks.

label: wrench

label: supermarket

label: broiler
definition: A part of an oven or a small stove used to broil food.

label: tote bin
definition: A portable, box-type industrial storage product used for the storage and handling or parts and materials, that may collapse to conserve space when not in use.

label: tote bag

definition: A factory where raw materials are treated or prepared for final processing.

definition: A factory for processing, packaging, labelling, handling, and storing cheese.

label: meat processing plant
SYNONYMS: butchery|freezing works|meat factory|meat packaging plant|meat plant|packinghouse|slaughter plant|slaughterhouse
definition: A processing plant for slaughtering, processing, packaging, labelling, handling, and storing of food animal carcasses, parts of carcasses, and meat products.

label: stable bandage
SYNONYMS: stable bandage|stable gauze|stall gauze|standing bandage|standing wrap
definition: A bandage wrap used on the lower legs of a horse.

label: charcuterie shop
definition: A delicatessen which prepares and sells preserved meat products.

label: manure
definition: An environmental material consisting of organic matter from plants and/or animals that is used in agriculture as fertilizer.

label: baseboard

label: cork
definition: Plant matter consisting of an impermeable buoyant material, the phellem layer of bark tissue.

label: natural-based polymer
definition: Macromolecules that are obtained naturally from plants or animals.

label: cellophane
definition: A thin, transparent sheet made of regenerated cellulose.

label: pliofilm
definition: Synthetic plastic which is composed of a glossy, moistureproof membrane made of rubber hydrochloride.

label: mylar

label: ceramic
definition: A solid environmental material that is hard, brittle, heat-resistant and corrosion-resistant, made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral at a high temperature.

label: booth
definition: A human construction which is an enclosure or compartment designed for service provision.

label: switch
definition: A device which can connect, disconnect, or divert current in an electrical circuit.

label: environmental monitoring area
definition: An environmental system where environmental monitoring processes are in effect.

label: environmental monitoring program area
definition: An environmental monitoring area which is under observation by humans belonging to organisations with a legislative mandate to monitor the area.

label: food production environmental monitoring zone
definition: An environmental monitoring program area within a food production facility.

label: food production environmental monitoring zone 1
subClassOf [LABEL]: some food production environmental monitoring zone|
definition: An object aggregate which comprises objects whose surfaces are in contact with food during its processing in a food production facility

label: food production environmental monitoring zone 2
subClassOf [LABEL]: some food production environmental monitoring zone|
definition: An object aggregate which comprises objects whose surfaces are not in contact with food during its processing, but which are in close proximity to those in food production environmental monitoring zone 1.

label: food production environmental monitoring zone 3
subClassOf [LABEL]: some food production environmental monitoring zone|
definition: An object aggregate which comprises a facility's set of more remote non-food-processing-contact surfaces that are in or near the processing areas (food productions environmental monitoring zones 1 and 2) and could lead to their contamination, especially through human movement.

label: food production environmental monitoring zone 4
subClassOf [LABEL]: some food production environmental monitoring zone|
definition: An object aggregate which comprises objects in proximity to food production environmental monitoring zone 3.

label: hygienic food production area
definition: An environmental system which is part of a food production facility and whose boundaries are defined by hygienic requirements.

label: food prossessing non-production area
definition: A hygienic food production area which is not an immediate part of a food manufacturing process area.

label: food production low-risk contamination area
definition: A hygienic food production area containing products having a low risk of contamination.

label: food production medium-risk contamination area
definition: A hygienic food production area in which general food processing occurs.

label: food production high-risk contamination area
definition: A hygienic food production area containing food products that are not subjected to subsequent microbial decontamination, and where there is a risk of pathogen or microbial spoilage growth.

label: residential environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment which provides long-term shelter for its inhabitants.

label: latex
SYNONYMS: Natural rubber, India rubber, Gum elastic, Non-vulcanized rubber
definition: A stable dispersion (emulsion) of polymer microparticles in an aqueous medium.

label: transport boat
definition: A boat which is used to transport cargo or carry passengers.

label: bottle
definition: A container which is typically made of glass or plastic and having a tapered neck, used primarily for holding liquids.

label: utensil
definition: A hand tool for domestic use, especially in the kitchen.

label: fork
definition: An eating utensil with spikes used to put solid food into the mouth, or to hold food down while cutting.

label: spoon
definition: An eating utensil with a scooped end and a long handle.

label: cup
definition: A utensil which is a hand-sized container with an open top.

label: healthcare environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment which is bounded by a healthcare facility in which health care services are provided by specialized staff and equipment.

label: occupational environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment which is the product of a particular human occupational acitivity.

label: child care environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment which is designed for child care.

label: child care facility
definition: A facility in which child care services are provided to a human child by specialised staff and equipment.

label: day care facility
subClassOf [LABEL]: some day care building|child care facility
definition: A child care facility in which day care services are provided, by specialized staff and equipment, to a human child during the working day.

label: place of worship
definition: A human construction in which individuals or a group of people such as a congregation come to perform acts of devotion, veneration, or religious study.

label: temple
definition: A building reserved in which religious or spiritual rituals and activities such as prayer and sacrifice are performed.

label: human nursery
definition: A child care facility in which child care services are provided to young children and babies.

label: household environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment which is bounded by a human dwelling.

label: community service centre
definition: A public building in which health, recreation or other public services to a local community are provided.

label: community health centre
definition: A healthcare facility which is used by a group of general practitioners and nurses to provide healthcare services to people in a certain area.

label: dormitory
definition: A room which contains 1) a number of beds for sleeping and 2) often some other furniture and/or residential utilities.

label: first nations reserve
definition: A political entity which is defined by contract between the Canadian state ("the Crown") and a First Nations people.

label: insecure housing
definition: A human dwelling which may be unsustainable over the long term for an inhabitant because of financial, livability, overcrowding or other factors.

label: temporary residence
definition: A human dwelling which is provided to one or more persons on a short-term basis.

label: chopstick
definition: An eating utensil which is a thin stick used in equal length pairs to manipulate food and bring it into a mouth.

label: hotel
definition: A building which 1) containing multiple dwellings of pre-furnished accomodation and 2) is rented on a short term and/or longer-term basis.

label: veterinary facility
definition: A healthcare facility which is used to provide healthcare services to animals.

label: airplane
definition: An aircraft which 1) has fixed wings and 2) is propelled by a thrust from a jet engine, propeller, or rocket engine.

label: physician office
definition: A healthcare facility which is the office of a physician.

label: ground transport
definition: A constructed transport system which is designed to transport people or objects over land, but not water or air.

label: animal rescue shelter
definition: An animal house which houses stray, lost, abandoned or surrendered animals.

label: eating utensil
definition: A utensil used for consuming food.

label: steel
definition: A manufactured product which is an alloy of iron and which typically contains a few tenths of a percent of carbon.

label: public-private prison
definition: A prison facility which is owned by the state and operated by a private corporation.

label: conveyor system
definition: A system which is composed of one or more machines that can continuously transport material from one location to at least one other location.

label: manufacturing equipment
definition: A manufactured product which is capable of some manufacturing process.

label: processing line
definition: A system which consists of manufacturing equipment that performs manufacturing processes in a linear fashion.

label: equipment frame
definition: A manufactured product which is a structural system on which equipment components are mounted.

label: equipment leg
definition: A manufactured product which positions a piece of equipment above a surface.

label: belt conveyor system
definition: A conveyor system which uses conveyer belt machines to transport material.

label: conveyor belt component
definition: A manufactured product which is 1) an endless belt of flexible material stretched between two drums; 2) conveys material between drum locations.

label: packaging equipment
definition: A manufacturing equipment piece which is used to package material.

label: bucket conveyor
definition: A conveyor system which is used to transport granular material vertically in open containers.

label: screw conveyor
definition: A conveyor system which consists of a helicoid flight mounted in a tube or shaft.

label: pneumatic conveyor
definition: A conveyor system which transports dry bulk particulate or granular material through a pipeline by a stream of gas.

label: conveyor roller
definition: A manufactured product which is a cylindrical (or approximately cylindrical) item used under a heavy object to facilitate moving it.

label: seam surface
definition: An interface layer which is formed where either two parts of a material entity or two separate material entities touch or are attached to one another along some length.

label: stagnant water
definition: A liquid water which has no current or flow and is susceptible to contamination by pathogens or pathogenic vectors.

label: wood dust
definition: Dust which is 1) generated when wood is processed and 2) composed primarily of cellulose, polyoses, and lignin.

label: brake fluid
definition: A hydraulic fluid which is 1) used in hydraulic brake and hydraulic clutch applications in vehicles to amplify braking force and 2) composed primarily of ethylene glycol, polyglycols, silicone fluids, and isobutyl alcohol.

label: automatic transmission fluid
definition: Fluid used for valve operation, brake band friction, and gear lubrication within an automatic vehicle transmission.

label: famine
definition: An environmental system process during which populations have reduced access to food, causing increased hunger, malnutrition, and consequent mortality.

label: hydraulic fluid
definition: A medium by which power is transferred in hydraulic machinery.

label: motor oil
definition: A lubricant for internal combustion engines which 1) reduces friction and wear 2) cleans the engine 3) neutralizes acids 4) improves sealing of piston rings, and 5) cools the engine.

label: diesel fuel
definition: A liquid fuel used in diesel engines, whose fuel ignition takes place, without any spark, as a result of compression of the inlet air mixture and then injection of fuel.

label: gasoline
definition: A clear petroleum-derived flammable liquid which is used as fuel in most spark-ignited internal combustion engines.

label: diesel exhaust

definition: A gas which results from the incomplete or complete combustion of diesel fuel.

label: gasoline exhaust
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:15368|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:15377|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16134|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16136|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16183|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16526|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16716|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16842|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:17245|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:17578|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:17790|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:18407|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:18422|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:24632|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:24840|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:25567|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:30751|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:33585|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:33666|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:33749|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:35196|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:39478|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:48107|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:51084|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:51143|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:5686|BFO:0000051 some ENVO:01000060|ENVO:01000797|RO:0001000 some ENVO:03510007
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some | some gasoline| some particulate environmental material|gaseous environmental material
definition: A gas which results from the complete or incomplete combustion of gasoline fuel.

label: dye
definition: A coloured substance that chemically bonds to the substrate to which it is being applied

label: leather dye
definition: Pigments carried by solvents or water which are applied to leather to be absorbed into the pores of the leather to deposit coloration.

label: paper dye
definition: Dyes used for the coloration or brightening of paper.

label: textile dye
definition: Dyes utilized for coloring textiles such as wool or cellulose fibers.

label: India ink
definition: A black or colored ink which is 1) used for writing, printing, and drawing and 2) made from fine soot (lampblack) and water.

label: xanthan gum
definition: A polysaccharide that functions as an emulsifier, stabilizer, and thickener in mixtures.

label: tragacanth
definition: A naturally occurring plant-based gum, which functions as a viscous, odorless, tasteless, water-soluble mixture of polysaccharides that absorbs water to become a gel/paste.

label: fountain pen ink
definition: Water based ink intended for use with fountain ink pens.

label: resin
definition: A solid or highly viscous plant or synthetic based substance that is typically convertible into polymers.

label: cleaning agent
definition: A liquid, powder, spray, or granule used to remove dirt, including dust, stains, bad smells, and clutter on surfaces.

label: degreaser
definition: A cleaning agent which 1) contains organic solvents and 2) dissolves oils and fats for the removal of grease.

label: varnish
definition: A clear transparent hard protective film or finish, primarily used for wood finishing applications.

label: resin (gum) varnish
definition: A varnish containing a natural, plant- or insect-derived substance dissolved in a solvent, called spirit varnish or solvent varnish.

label: shellac
definition: A resin secreted by the female lac bug, which is dissolved in alcohol to be used as a brush-on colorant, food glaze, and wood finish.

label: lacquer
definition: A category of hard and potentially shiny (clear or colored) finishes which can be applied to materials including wood or metal.

label: paint thinner
definition: A solvent that can dissolve paint and reduce viscosity of paint or "thin" it.

label: acrylic paint medium
definition: A liquid, gel, or paste that can be mixed into acrylic paint to alter paint consistency and properties.

label: enamel thinner
definition: A paint thinner specific for altering the viscosity of enamel paints.

label: oil paint thinner
definition: A solvent used to thin oil-based paints or clean up after their use.

label: primer (paint)
definition: A paint product which adheres to surfaces and forms a binding layer, preparing it to receive paint.

label: vitreous enamel
definition: A smooth, durable vitreous coating which is made by fusing powdered glass to a substrate.

label: oil-based paint
definition: A slow-drying paint that consists of particles of pigment suspended in a drying oil, commonly linseed oil.

label: acrylic paint
definition: A water soluble, fast-drying paint made of pigment suspended in acrylic polymer emulsion.

label: luminescent paint
definition: A paint that exhibits luminescence, giving off visible light through fluorescence, phosphorescence, or radioluminescence.

label: turpentine
SYNONYMS: oil of turpentine|spirit of turpentine|turps|wood turpentine
definition: A fluid obtained by the distillation of resin harvested from living trees, primarily used as a solvent.

label: naphtha
definition: A flammable liquid hydrocarbon mixture produced from natural gas condensates, petroleum distillates, and the distillation of coal tar and peat.

label: rock dust
definition: Dust which is composed of minerals and trace elements, generated by  finely crushed rock.

label: radioactive material
definition: Any material containing unstable atoms that emit ionizing radiation as it decays.

label: volume of cyanoacrylate
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of cyanoacrolate.

label: obsolete plastic production compound
definition: OBSOLETE A compound utilized for the production of plastics or polymers.

label: stain
definition: A preparation with dye or pigment used to deposit coloration to a substrate.

label: wood stain
definition: A stain which has colorants dissolved and/or suspended in a vehicle or solvent, used to add color to wood.

label: rubber cement
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some glue| some manufacturing process|environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is composed of elastic polymers mixed in a solvent.

label: methyl cellulose paste
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some glue| some manufacturing process|environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is 1) composed primarily of methyl cellulose and water, and 2) formulated to fix wallpaper to walls.

label: permanent hair dye
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some chemical colorant| some manufacturing process|environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is 1) manufactured and 2) primarily composed of hydrogen peroxide and ammonia, and 3) when applied to hair, can alter the natural hair pigments for 6-8 weeks.

label: pharmaceutical ink
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:16997|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:30879|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:32234|ENVO:03510065|RO:0002353 some ENVO:01000993
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some manufacturing process|colorant fluid
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured and 2) composed of alcohol, titanium dioxide, and propylene glycol.

label: gel ink
subClassOf [ID]: BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:15377|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:155903|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:18154|BFO:0000051 some CHEBI:50816|ENVO:03510065|RO:0002353 some ENVO:01000993
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some | some | some manufacturing process|colorant fluid
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured and 2) composed of copper phthalocyanine, iron oxides, water, and biopolymers.

label: soy ink
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some manufacturing process| some resin| some wax|colorant fluid
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured and 2) primarily composed of soybean oil, as well as pigment, resin, and wax.

label: aqueous inkjet printer ink
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some | some dye| some manufacturing process|colorant fluid
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured, 2) primarily composed of water, as well as glycol, and dye, and 3) intended for use in inkjet printers.

label: emissions from petroleum combustion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some combustion process| some petroleum|environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is composed primarily of gases and particles produced by the combustion of petroleum fuels.

label: colorant fluid
definition: A liquid environmental material which 1) contains at least one substance which can act as a chemical colorant.

label: chemical colorant
definition: A function which is realised by a chemical when applied to a material, such that it alters the material's colour.

label: toxic waste
definition: Waste which contains toxic components (e.g., heavy metals or radiation) which can cause harm to organisms and/or the environment.

label: low atmospheric level
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric boundary layer|(( some planetary surface) and ( some middle atmospheric level)) and ( some troposphere)|atmospheric layer

label: middle atmospheric level
subClassOf [LABEL]: (( some low atmospheric level) and ( some high atmospheric level)) and ( some troposphere)|atmospheric layer

label: high atmospheric level
subClassOf [LABEL]: (( some stratosphere) and ( some middle atmospheric level)) and ( some troposphere)|atmospheric layer

label: cloud part
definition: A part of a cloud.

label: cloud base
definition: A cloud part which is closest to the surface of the astronomical body local to the cloud.

label: cloud top
definition: A cloud part which is furthest from the surface of the astronomical body local to the cloud.

label: supercooled water droplet
definition: A water droplet which exists at temperatures below 0C (273.15K).

label: snow crystal
definition: A water ice crystal which is constituted by water molecules aligned in a hexagonal array.

label: cleanroom
definition: A building part which is maintained such that the number of foreign particulates within it is controlled.

label: chemically contaminated sediment
definition: Sediment which contains some chemical contaminant.

label: cooling water
definition: Liquid water which is a participant in a water cooling process.

label: drinking water pipeline network
definition: A pipeline network which is used to transport drinking water to consumers.

label: drinking water treatment plant
definition: An industrial building in which water undergoes a purification process to make it fit for human consumption.

label: electrical switch
definition: A manufactured product which is capable of connecting or disconnecting the conducting path in an electrical circuit, interrupting the electric current or diverting it from one conductor to another.

label: food waste
definition: A waste material which is primarily composed of uneaten food and removed from the food supply chain.

label: formation fluid
definition: A fluid environmental material which is contained in geologic formations naturally.

label: intensive care unit
definition: A building part which has been constructed to support the provision of intensive care medicine to patients with severe or life-threatening illnesses and injuries.

label: interstitial water
definition: Liquid water which occurs naturally within the pores of rocks and sediments.

label: membrane bioreactor
definition: A bioreactor which has a membrane as a part

label: mineral horizon
definition: A soil horizon which is primarily composed of mineral material.

label: oil pipeline network
definition: A pipeline network which is used to transport oil to consumers.

label: bituminous sand
definition: An environmental material which consists of either loose sands or partially consolidated sandstone, containing a naturally occurring mixture of sand, clay, and water, soaked with a dense and extremely viscous form of petroleum.

label: pipeline network
definition: A human construction which is used to transport a material which is primarily composed of liquid or gas through a system of pipes.

label: polluted river
subClassOf [LABEL]: has increased levels of some ( and ( some ))|river
definition: A river which has elevated levels of contaminants.

label: saprolite
definition: Rock which is derived from bedrock through chemical weathering

label: slurry
definition: An environmental material which is composed of insoluble solid particles suspended in a liquid.

label: organic horizon
definition: A soil horizon which is composed primarily of organic matter.

label: sugarcane vinasse
definition: Vinasse which is produced during the rectification and distillation of ethanol from sugar cane.

label: tailings dam
definition: An earth-filled dam which is used for the storage of mining operations byproducts, after separating the ore from the gangue.

label: tailings pond
definition: A human construction which is used as a storage area for mining tailings.

label: vinasse
definition: A manufactured product which is formed as a liquid byproduct generated during the rectification and distillation of ethanol.

label: soil horizon
definition: A soil layer which is parallel to the soil surface and which has roughly homogenous physical, chemical and biological properties relative to the soil layers above or beneath it.

label: earth-filled dam
definition: An embankment dam which is primarily composed of compacted earth.

label: embankment dam
definition: A dam which is created by the placement and compaction of a complex semi-plastic mound of various compositions of soil, sand, clay, or rock.

label: residential backyard
definition: A yard which consists of land immediately adjacent to the back of a residential building

label: cay
definition: An island which is small, low in elevation, sandy, and located on the surface of a coral reef.

label: cold room
definition: A room which is maintained at lower than ambient temperatures.

label: pathogen-suppressive soil
definition: Soil which has properties that restrict a pathogen's ability to establish itself, persist, or cause disease that results in long-term harm.

label: eutrophic pond
definition: A pond which has nutrient-rich water.

label: experimental forest ecosystem
definition: A forest ecosystem which is designated for research.

label: fermentation pit
definition: A pit which has been constructed for use in fermentation processes that will yield alcoholic spirits.

label: fermentation starter
definition: A manufactured product which assists starting a fermentation process which is intended to prepare foods and alcoholic drinks.

label: marine lake
definition: A lake which is connected to a marine water body via tunnels or cracks in the soil.

label: marine lake water
definition: Liquid water which is either part of or was removed from a marine lake.

label: meromictic pond
definition: A pond which has layers of water that do not intermix.

label: organic farm
definition: A farm which is managed using practices certified to be organic by a competent authority.

label: plant pot
definition: A manufactured product which is designed to function as a container for growing plants.

label: processed tobacco
definition: A manufactured product which is produced by curing, subsequent aging, slow oxidation and degradation of carotenoids in tobacco leaves.

label: raceway pond
definition: A pond which humans have constructed for the cultivation of algae.

label: shower curtain
definition: A manufactured product which is composed of flexible material and is intended to be hung such that it impedes the spray of water between a shower fixture and the rest of a room.

label: smokeless tobacco
definition: Processed tobacco which has been treated for use by placing it between the gum and cheek or lip, chewed, or sniffed, but not smoked.

label: space station
definition: A spacecraft which is capable of supporting a human crew in orbit for an extended period of time.

label: train car
definition: A vehicle which is used for carrying cargo or passengers on a rail transport system.

label: water tap
definition: A manufactured product which is controls the flow of water.

label: yard
definition: An anthropogenic geographic feature which consists of land immediately adjacent to a building or a group of buildings.

label: touchscreen
definition: A manufactured product which is used to give input or control to an information processing system by touching a display screen with a special stylus or one or more fingers.

label: shipwreck
definition: Anthropogenic litter which consists of an abandoned ship's remains.

label: fountain
definition: A human construction which supplies drinking water by squirting it into a basin or jets water into the air for a decorative or dramatic effect.

label: tube well
definition: A water well in which a long, 100200 millimetres-wide, stainless steel tube or pipe is bored into an underground aquifer to lift water using a pump.

label: microbialite
definition: A sedimentary rock which is made of carbonate mud whose formation is mediated by microbes in the benthic zone.

label: spring water
definition: Water which comes from a spring.

label: halite
definition: A salt mass which consists of isometric crystals of sodium chloride (NaCl).

label: neonatal intensive care unit
definition: An intensive care unit (ICU) specializing in the care of ill or premature newborn infants.

label: ice wedge
definition: A geological fracture which is formed during winter months by a narrow or thin piece of ice.

label: nest of alligator
definition: An animal habitation which is built by alligators from plants and decomposing vegetation in order to protect their eggs from predators.

label: river plume
definition: An oceanic front in which mixing of river discharge and saline seawater occurs.

label: cyanobacterial bloom
definition: A feature which arises from a rapid multiplication of cyanobacteria, causing marked visible discoloration of the water.

label: ophiolites
definition: A planetary structural layer which consists of oceanic crust and the underlying upper mantle and has been uplifted and exposed above sea level.

label: contaminated land
definition: Land which has elevated levels of some contaminants or substances that are potentially hazardous to health or the environment.

label: aquaculture farm
definition: An agricultural aquatic ecosystem in which fish, crustaceans, mollusks, aquatic plants and algae are cultivated.

label: oil mill
definition: An industrial building in which oil-bearing seeds or vegetable materials are crushed and pressed with a grinding mill in order to extract oils.

label: waste stabilization pond
definition: A human construction which confines wastewater in a depression enclosed by earthen structures.

label: photobioreactor
definition: A bioreactor which utilizes a light source to cultivate phototrophic microorganisms.

label: oil refinery
definition: An industrial building in which crude oil is transformed and refined into useful products.

label: shredder
definition: A manufactured product which is used for cutting crops, vegetables, wood, metal, paper documents, etc into small pieces.

label: industrial park
definition: A human construction which is used for the purpose of industrial development.

label: cloud water
definition: Fresh water which is harvested from cloud.

label: crustal fluid
definition: Fluid environmental material which is present in the continental crust and dictates the nature and extent of crustal deformation.

label: mofetta
definition: A geological fracture, found near volacnoes in the final phase of thier activity, chiefly discharging carbon dioxide and possibly other vapors.

label: lichen material
definition: An organic material which is derived from lichen mats.

label: buoy
definition: A manufactured product which floats in water and can be used a navigational marker among other purposes.

label: water filter
definition: A manufactured product which is used to remove contaminants from water impeding the flow of particles or solutes.

label: greenhouse
definition: A human construction which provides regulated climatic conditions for the growth of plants and whose walls and roof are made chiefly of transparent material, such as glass.

label: alcohol fermentation pit
definition: A fermentation pit which is constructed to facilitate the fermentation of alcoholic substances.

label: clay fermentation pit
definition: A fermentation pit which is constructed from clay.

label: artificial pond
definition: A pond which has been constructed by humans or their technologies.

label: artificial satellite
definition: A human construction that has intentionally been placed into orbit.

label: stream pool
definition: A water body which is created in a stream by local scour or impoundment and has some structural control.

label: stream run
definition: A hydroform which is that part of a stream where water flows swiftly and uniformly with low surface water agitation.

label: step pool
definition: A stream pool which is formed as a result of high-gradient, steep streams where water cascades over a rock or woody snag.

label: periphytic biofilm
definition: Biofilm consisting of a mixture of algae, cyanobacteria, microbes, and detritus.

label: epilithon
definition: Periphyton colonizing rock substrata

label: epipelon
definition: Periphyton colonizing silt substrata

label: epiphyton
definition: Periphyton colonizing surface of aquatic plants

label: epipsammon
definition: Periphyton colonizing sand substrata

label: epixylon
definition: Periphyton colonizing woody substrata

label: stream water
definition: Water which is part of a stream.

label: freshwater stream
definition: A stream which is composed primarily of fresh water.

label: freshwater stream biome
definition: A freshwater stream ecosystem which is in its climactic successional state.

label: freshwater stream ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which has its functions and composition determined by a freshwater stream.

label: Albany Thicket ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion in the Eastern Cape of South Africa with vegetation characterized by sclerophyllous and succulent shrubs.

label: Lowland Fynbos and Renosterveld ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion in the Cape Floristic Region of South Africa containing vegetation of the mediterranean shrubland biome [ENVO:01000217] occurring below 300 m.

label: Montane Fynbos and Renosterveld ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion in the Cape Floristic Region of South Africa containing vegetation of the mediterranean shrubland biome [ENVO:01000217] occurring above 300 m.

label: Drakensberg Alti-Montane Grassland and Woodland ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion in the montane grassland biome [ENVO:01001808] in the Drakensberg mountains of southern Africa above 2500 m.

label: Drakensberg Montane Grassland, Woodland, and Forest ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion in the montane grassland biome [ENVO:01001808] in the Drakensberg mountains of southern Africa between 1800 and 2500 m.

label: Highveld Grassland ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion in the montane grassland biome [ENVO:01001808] in the interior plateau of southern Africa between 1400 and 1800 m.

label: biogeographic realm
definition: An ecosystem which is surrounded by natural, macro- to megascale geographic barriers to species migration, and thus which comprises ecological communities with evolutionary histories largely delimited by those barriers.

label: adfreezing
definition: Adfreezing is a freezing process during which two objects adhere to each other via ice.

label: frost heaving process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (permafrost or soil)| some freezing of water into water ice| some planetary surface|cryoturbation of soil
definition: Frost heaving is a process during which an upwards swelling of soil occurs due to freezing conditions caused by an increasing presence of ice as it grows towards the surface.

label: temperature of sea surface
subClassOf [LABEL]: some sea surface layer|temperature of water
SYNONYMS: ocean surface temperature|sea surface temperature|temperature of the ocean surface
definition: A water temperature which inheres in water close to the surface of an ocean or sea.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in soil
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in soil.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in air
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in air.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in freshwater
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in freshwater.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in seawater
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in seawater.

label: lake water
definition: Water which is part of a lake.

label: soil organic matter
definition: Organic material in soil, which consists of plant and animal residues at various stages of decomposition, cells and tissues of soil organisms, and substances synthesized by soil organisms.

label: active permafrost layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some permafrost| some permafrost thawing process|active layer in a cryosphere
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that is 1) subject to annual thawing and freezing and 2) present in areas underlain by permafrost.

label: soil surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of soil.

label: bare soil surface layer
definition: A soil surface which is exposed to the troposphere, with no appreciable cover from vegetation or other material.

label: particulate organic matter
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of organic material.

label: particulate organic carbon
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of carbon.

label: particulate organic nitrogen
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of nitrogen.

label: carbon sequestration process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric carbon dioxide|material accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which atmospheric carbon dioxide is captured and stored.

label: biotic carbon sequestration
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which atmospheric carbon dioxide is captured and stored by biological processes.

label: geological carbon sequestration
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which carbon dioxide is stored in underground geological formations.

label: carbon sequestration by the ocean carbonate system
subClassOf [LABEL]: some carbonate system of ocean water| some ocean|carbon sequestration process
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which carbon dioxide is stored in the carbonate system of an ocean.

label: thermoplasticity
definition: A disposition inhering in a bearer by virtue of that bearer's ability to, repeatedly, become plastic on heating and harden again on cooling.

label: thermoplastic material
definition: An environmental material which is capable of, repeatedly, becoming plastic when heated and hardening again when cooled.

label: thermosetting disposition
definition: A disposition which inheres in materials capable of becoming rigid when cured by heating.

label: thermoset polymer
definition: A polymer which has been irreversibly hardened by heat-induced curing.

label: piece of plastic foam
definition: A piece of plastic which has a matrix- or sponge-like structure with numerous, hollow internal spaces.

label: plastic film
SYNONYMS: Kunststofffolie|Plastikfolie|pellicola di plastica|pelcula de plstico|plastic membrane|plastic sheet
definition: A piece of plastic which is flexible, thin, and planar.

label: plastic fragment
SYNONYMS: Plastikfragment|fragmento de plstico|frammento di plastica|plastic flake|plastic granule
definition: A piece of plastic which 1) is hard, 2) has an irregular shape, and 3) has broken off of a larger piece of plastic.

label: plastic line
definition: A piece of plastic which is linear and flexible.

label: plastic pellet
SYNONYMS: mermaid's tears|pellet de plstico|pellet di plastica|resin bead
definition: A piece of plastic which is 1) hard, 2) has a smooth external surface, and 3) has a roughly spherical or granular shape.

label: water column
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which 1) vertically spans a water body and 2) has fiat boundaries approximating a columnar shape.

label: biota
definition: A collection of organisms which inhabits the same region, ecosystem, or time period.

label: marine biota
SYNONYMS: Meeresbiota|biota marino|biota marino|marine life|ocean life|sea life
definition: A biota which inhabits a marine ecosystem.

label: biodegradation
definition: A biological process during which a material entity is broken down.

label: biodegradation of plastic
SYNONYMS: Biologischer Plastikabbauprozess|biodegradacin del plstico|biodegradazione della plastica|biological degradation of plastics
definition: A biodegradation process during which plastic is broken down.

label: foamed plastic
definition: A plastic which has a matrix- or sponge-like structure with numerous, hollow internal spaces.

label: quality of a foam
definition: A physical quality which inheres in a liquid or solid bearer by virtue of that bearer trapping a gas in a colloidal suspension throughout its volume.

label: ingestion
definition: A feeding behavior during which material is taken into the body of an organism.

label: adsorption
definition: A material accumulation process during which material adheres to a solid or liquid surface.

label: fouling
definition: A material accumulation process during which material builds up on a solid surface such that a function of that surface, or the object it is a part of, is impaired.

label: biofouling
definition: A fouling process during which biological matter accumulates on a solid surface.

label: adhesion
definition: An environmental system process during which two dissimilar materials attach to one another.

label: cohesion
definition: An environmental system process during which the molecules of similar materials are electrically attracted to one another, leading to the formation and maintenance of a microscopic structure holding the materials together.

label: granule of plastic foam
definition: A piece of plastic foam which has a near-spherical or granular shape.

label: fragmentation process
definition: An environmental system process during which a material entity breaks into pieces or parts.

label: fragmentation due to weathering
definition: A fragmentation process which is caused by weathering.

label: plastic
definition: An environnmental material which 1) is composed primarily of polymers with high molecular mass and 2) once deformed does not spontaneously return to its original shape.

label: megaplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which is greater than 1 metre in its longest dimension.

label: macroplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which is between 25 and 1000 millimetres in its longest dimension.

label: mesoplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which is between 5 and 25 millimetres in its longest dimension.

label: nanoplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which has a diameter less than 1 micrometre.

label: plastisphere
definition: A part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the entities which are composed primarily of plastic and which are within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body.

label: marine anthropogenic litter
definition: Anthropogenic litter which is present in the marine environment.

label: littering
definition: An anthropogenic environmental process during which waste is improperly disposed of into the environment.

label: litter role
definition: A role which 1) inheres in a material entity 2) is realised when that entity is discarded outside waste management systems by humans or their technologies.

label: manufactured plastisphere
definition: A plastisphere which is composed primarily of manufactured plastic.

label: natural plastic
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (environmental system process or )| some (not (manufacturing process))|plastic
definition: Plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by processes whose agents do not include humans or their technologies.

label: synthetic plastic
definition: A plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by a manufacturing process.

label: fishing
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which any number of fish are caught by humans or their technologies.

label: ghost fishing
definition: An anthropogenic environmental process during which abandoned, lost, or discarded fishing gear attracts and entangles organisms.

label: fishing gear
definition: A manufactured product which is used for fishing.

label: discarded fishing gear
SYNONYMS: attrezzo di pesca scartato|entsorgte Angelausrstung|equipo de pesca desechado|weggeworfene Angelausrstung|weggeworfene Fischerreiausrstung|weggeworfenes Angelzubehr
definition: Abandoned fishing gear which was intentionally left unmaintained and uncontrolled by its custodian.

label: abandoned fishing gear
definition: Fishing gear which is not under the control of or maintained by its custodian.

label: lost fishing gear
SYNONYMS: attrezzo di pesca perso|equipo de pesca perdido|verschollene Angelausrstung
definition: Abandoned fishing gear which was unintentionally left unmaintained and uncontrolled by its custodian.

label: weathering
definition: A material transformation process during which the properties of a material are changed as a result of in situ exposure to atmospheric processes.

label: entanglement process
definition: An environmental system process during which material entities become entrapped, wrapped, twisted, entwined, or otherwise caught in one another.

label: entanglement of organisms in marine debris
subClassOf [LABEL]: some | some ( and ( some ))| some anthropogenic litter|entanglement process
definition: An entanglement process during which organisms become entrapped in anthropogenic marine debris.

label: biopolymer
definition: A polymer which is the output of a biological process.

label: synthetic polymer
definition: A polymer which is the output of a manufacturing process.

label: coastal anthropogenic litter
definition: Anthropogenic litter which is present in a coastal environment.

label: plastic manufacturing process
SYNONYMS: Plastikherstellung|plastic production|produccin de plstico|produzione di plastica
definition: A manufacturing process which includes plastic as one of its specified outputs.

label: weathering of plastic
definition: Weathering during which plastic is worn or broken down.

label: water table
subClassOf [LABEL]: some phreatic zone| some vadose zone|surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is 1) part of a phreatic zone in contact with a vadose zone and 2) contains interstitial water with a pressure head equal to atmospheric pressure.

label: soil compaction process
definition: Soil compaction is a compaction process during which the bulk density of soil increases and/or its porosity decreases due to externally or internally applied loads.

label: water table depth
SYNONYMS: depth of the water table|depth to the water table|height of the water table
definition: An elevation which inheres in a water table by virture of its vertical distance from a land surface.

label: photosynthetic photon flux density
subClassOf [LABEL]: some irradiation by photosynthetically active radiation|
definition: A rate which is characteristic of irradiance by photosynthetically active radiation by virtue of the number of photons received by an irradiated surface over time.

label: compacted soil
definition: A soil which has a high bulk density and/or a low porosity. A compacted soil has a reduced rate of both water infiltration and drainage

label: soil percolation rate
definition: A rate which inheres in a soil percolation process.

label: runoff
subClassOf [LABEL]: some (waste water or rainwater or meltwater or stormwater)|liquid water
definition: Liquid water which 1) flows over land and 2) is not absorbed or retained by the materials if flows over or through.

label: photosynthetic photon flux
definition: A flux which inheres in photosynthetically active radiation.

label: rainy day count
definition: The number of days during which there is precipitation

label: soil layer top depth
definition: The depth of the top part of a soil layer.

label: soil layer bottom depth
definition: The depth of the bottom part of a soil layer.

label: water infiltration
definition: A water flow process during which water occupies the pores or interstices of a solid or semi-solid material.

label: water infiltration into soil
definition: A water infiltration process during which water fills the pore space and interstices of soil.

label: soil albedo
definition: Albedo which inheres in soil.

label: dry soil albedo
definition: Soil albedo which inheres in dry soil.

label: moist soil albedo
definition: Soil albedo which inheres in moist soil.

label: exchangeable ion
definition: An ion which is 1) adsorbed onto the surfaces of materials with an opposing charge, 2) are readily displaced by other ions, 3) may be displaced and absorbed by organisms.

label: exchangeable potassium
definition: A potassium ion which is capable of ion exchange.

label: residual water in soil
definition: Liquid water which is present in soils as discontinuous volumnes of water in contact with solid and gaseous components of the soil.

label: exchangeable calcium
definition: A calcium ion which is capable of ion exchange.

label: cation exchange capacity
definition: A physical quality which inheres in an environmental material by virtue of the material's ability to adsorb exchangeable cations.

label: soil drainage
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water| some soil|drainage process
definition: A drainage process during which liquid water is transported away from soil.

label: basic cation exchange capacity
definition: A cation exchange capacity which inheres in an environmental material by virtue of the material's ability to adsorb basic exchangeable cations.

label: net shortwave radiation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some astronomical body| some stellar radiation|energy
definition: Energy which has been absorbed by an astronomical body or its parts following that body's irradiation by shortwave radiation from a star.

label: soil layer
definition: A layer that is composed primarily of soil.

label: soil profile characterization
definition: A planned process during which a soil profile is examined and the soil horizons that compose it are described.

label: treated wastewater
definition: Waste water which was converted into an effluent that can be either returned to the water cycle with minimal environmental issues or reused.

label: desalinated water
definition: Saline water from which minerals have been removed to produce fresh water suitable for human consumption or irrigation.

label: soil texture
definition: Texture which inheres in soil.

label: loamy sand
definition: Soil which is primarily composed of sand with silt and clay in progressively smaller proportions.

label: fine sand
definition: Sand which is composed primarily of fine particles.

label: sandy loam
subClassOf [LABEL]: has increased levels of some sand|loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: silty loam
subClassOf [LABEL]: has increased levels of some silt|loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: sandy clay loam
subClassOf [LABEL]: clay loam|has increased levels of some sand
definition: Clay loam which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: clay loam
subClassOf [LABEL]: has increased levels of some clay|loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of clay in its composition.

label: silty clay loam
subClassOf [LABEL]: clay loam|has increased levels of some silt
definition: Clay loam which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: sandy clay
definition: Clay which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: silty clay
definition: Clay which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: wastewater treatment process
definition: A recycling process during which wastewater is treated

label: desalination process
definition: A recycling process during which the dissolved mineral salts in water are removed

label: field capacity
subClassOf [LABEL]: concentration of liquid water in soil
definition: A concentration of liquid water in soil arrived at after water which is not retained by the soil has drained away.

label: permanent wilting point
subClassOf [LABEL]: concentration of liquid water in soil
definition: A concentration of liquid water in soil at or below which a plant will wilt and no longer recover its turgidity when placed in a water saturated atmosphere.

label: water-holding capacity of soil
definition: Water-holding capacity which inheres in some soil.

label: axilla skin environment
definition: An environment that is determined by an axilla skin.

label: mouth environment
definition: An environment that is determined by a mouth.

definition: The mass density of some snow.

label: hours of sunshine
definition: A one-dimensional temporal region during which an entity is exposed to stellar radiation.

label: drought
definition: A hydrological precipitation process with a reduced rate relative to some historical average, typically resulting in ecosystemic perturbations.

label: marine mucilage
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( some exudation of carbohydrates)| some (environmental material and ( some marine snow))|organic material
definition: A gelatinous material primarily composed of exopolymeric compounds with colloidal properties, formed through the aggregation of marine snow particles, often found in large sheets,  flocs, and clouds.

label: exudation of carbohydrates
definition: A process in which carbohydrates are transported from the interior of an organism to its surroundings.

label: island formation process
definition: A process which results in the formation of an island.

label: microcontinental island
definition: An island created when a continent is rifted.

label: depositional island
definition: An island formed by deposition of solid material such as sand or small rocks where a water current loses some of its carrying capacity.

label: barrier island
definition: An island formed by the accumulation of sand deposited by sea currents on a continental shelves

label: chemical product
definition: A manufactured product that is some mixture of chemicals created through some chemical engineering process

label: creosote
definition: The portion of chemical products obtained by the distillation of a tar that remains heavier than water, notably useful for its anti-septic and preservative properties

label: industrial wastewate treatment plant
definition: A wastewater treatment plant that treates industrial wastewater. Industrial wastewater treatment covers the mechanisms and processes used to treat waters that have been contaminated in some way by anthropogenic industrial or commercial activities prior to its release into the environment or its re-use.

label: agricultural wastewater treatment plant
definition: A wastewater treatment plant that treats agriculatural wastewater. Agricultural wastewater treatment relates to the treatment of wastewaters produced in the course of agricultural activities. Agriculture is a highly intensified industry in many parts of the world, producing a range of wastewaters requiring a variety of treatment technologies and management practices.

label: algal bloom
definition: A feature that arises from a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae (typically microscopic) in an aquatic system.

label: freshwater algal bloom
definition: An algal bloom that is located in freshwater. Freshwater algal blooms are the result of an excess of nutrients, particularly some phosphates.

label: nest of termite
definition: An animal habitation constructed by termites. Termite workers build and maintain nests which house the colony. These are elaborate structures made using a combination of soil, mud, chewed wood/cellulose, saliva, and faeces. A nest has many functions such as providing a protected living space and water conservation (through controlled condensation).

label: biochar
definition: charcoal that is used as a soil amendment.

label: lignite
definition: A soft, brown, combustible, sedimentary rock formed from naturally compressed peat.

label: bitumous coal
definition: a relatively soft coal containing a tarlike substance called bitumen or asphalt. It is of higher quality than lignite coal but of poorer quality than anthracite. It is an organic sedimentary rock formed by diagenetic and sub metamorphic compression of peat bog material.

label: anthracite
definition: A hard, compact variety of coal that has a submetallic luster. It has the highest carbon content, the fewest impurities, and the highest energy density of all types of coal and is the highest ranking of coal.

label: anthropogenic generation of energy
definition: The generation of energy for use by humans

label: energy
definition: A disposition which is realized during the execution of work, the emission of heat, or the possession of mass.

label: potential energy
definition: Energy possessed by an object because of its position relative to other objects, stresses within itself, its electric charge, or other factors.

label: kinetic energy
definition: Energy which is realised through motion.

label: mixed potential and kinetic energy
definition: Energy which is the sum of 1) kinetic energy and 2) potential energy.

label: electric energy
definition: potential energy due to or stored in electric fields.

label: magnetic energy
definition: potential energy due to or stored in magnetic fields.

label: gravitational energy
definition: potential energy due to or stored in gravitational fields.

label: chemical energy
definition: Potential energy which is stored in chemical bonds and realised through reactions which break them..

label: ionization energy
definition: potential energy that binds an electron to its atom or molecule.

label: nuclear energy
definition: potential energy that binds nucleons to form the atomic nucleus (and nuclear reactions).

label: chromodynamic energy
SYNONYMS: chromodynamic binding energy|gluon binding energy|quantum chromodynamics binding energy
definition: Potential energy due to the energy of the gluon-mediated field of the strong force, binding quarks together into hadrons.

label: elastic energy
definition: potential energy due to the deformation of a material (or its container) exhibiting a restorative force.

label: mechanical wave energy
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ( and ( some ))| some kinetic energy| some potential energy|wave energy
definition: Wave energy which inheres in an elastic material and is realised when a deformational wave passes through that material.

label: sound wave energy
definition: Mechanical wave energy which is realised when an acoustic wave propagates through a material.

label: radiant energy
definition: Potential energy which is stored in the fields of propagated by electromagnetic radiation.

label: rest energy
definition: potential energy due to an object's rest mass.

label: thermal energy
definition: Kinetic energy which is realised through the microscopic motion of particles.

label: wind wave energy
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmosphere| some atmospheric wind|mechanical wave energy
definition: Mechanical wave energy which inheres in an atmosphere and is realised during an atmospheric wind.

label: geothermal energy
definition: Thermal energy which propagates through a solid (typically rocky) astronomical body.

label: fossil fuel power plant
definition: A power station which burns a fossil fuel such as coal, natural gas, or petroleum to produce electricity.

label: coke
definition: Coal heated in the absence of air.

label: oxygen cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has oxygen as participant.

label: anatomical entity environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental system determined by an organism|environmental system
definition: An environment which is determined by an anatomical entity.

label: intestine environment
definition: An environmental system determined by an intestine.

label: skin environment
definition: An environment determined by an area or zone of skin tissue.

label: microwave radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths and frequencies which travel exclusively in a line-of-sight fashion and which may produce molecular rotation and torsion on contact with matter.

label: radio wave radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths ranging from millimetre to kilometer scales.

label: infrared radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted when molecules change their rotational-vibrational movements, usually at wavelengths between 760 nm and 1 mm.

label: visible spectrum radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths between 380 nm and 760 nm.

label: ultraviolet radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

label: X-ray radiation
definition: A radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted by high-energy electrons as they fall into a lower state of energy.

label: gamma-ray radiation
definition: A radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted from the radioactive decay (gamma decay) of atomic nuclei.

label: ionizing radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted with sufficient energy to disrupt molecular bonds or alter the electron number of atoms.

label: Earth
definition: third planet from the Sun in the Solar System

label: Suni
definition: "Suni, or Jalca, is one of the eight Natural Regions of Peru. It is located in the Andes at an altitude between 3,500 and 4,000 metres above sea level. Suni has a dry and cold weather and there are many glacial valleys. The flora includes gramineous plants and shrubs such as the taya-taya (Caesalpinia spinosa), the quishuar (Buddleja coriacea), and the cantuta (Cantua buxifolia) which was considered sacred by the Incas. Even though it is hard for plants to grow because of the weather, people are able to cultivate such crops as quinoa, qaiwa, broad beans and ulluku (Ullucus tuberosus). The main fauna is the guinea pig and, among numerous other highland birds, the Chiguanco thrush."

label: World Ocean
